ADVENTIST HEALTH PROVIDES THIS THROUGH TWO LOCATIONS IN THE CITY OF CLEARLAKE, THE RESTORATION HOUSE -- A 10-BED TRANSITIONAL LIVING ENVIRONMENT -- AND THROUGH THE HOPE CENTER -- A 20-BED LOW-BARRIER ENTRY TRANSITIONAL HOUSING PROGRAM.   BASED ON THE SUCCESSES OF THE RESTORATION HOUSE, ADVENTIST HEALTH AIMS TO ACHIEVE TWO GOALS WITH THIS PROJECT:   GOAL 1: RESPOND TO INCREASED COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS FOR THE EXISTING RESTORATION HOUSE.  GOAL 2: OPEN A RESTORATION HOUSE IN THE COUNTIES OF YUBA AND SUTTER, USING THE SAME STAFFING AND OPERATING MODEL AS IN CLEARLAKE.  FUNDING WILL SPECIFICALLY BE USED TO SUPPORT PERSONNEL EXPENSES, FURNISH CLINICAL AND HOUSING ITEMS (SUCH AS HOSPITAL BEDS) AND OFFSET THE NEEDED LEASES.

RELIANCE HEALTH RECOVERY SUPPORT PROGRAM FY22 - THE NORWICH RECOVERY COACH PROGRAM (NRCP) IS A COMMUNITY-BASED PEER RECOVERY SUPPORT PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES MOTIVATIONAL ENGAGEMENT, INSPIRATIONAL SUPPORT, AND CONNECTIONS TO RESOURCES TO INDIVIDUALS STRUGGLING WITH SUBSTANCE USE CONCERNS. THIS INITIATIVE ALLOWS PEOPLE WHO ARE SEEKING ASSISTANCE WITH THEIR RECOVERY ACCESS TO A RECOVERY COACH (RC) THROUGH RELIANCE HEALTH. THIS PROGRAM STRIVES TO PLANT A SEED OF HOPE THAT RECOVERY IS POSSIBLE FOR THOSE SEEKING HELP, EMPOWER THE PERSON TO ENGAGE IN THE CREATION OF THEIR OWN RECOVERY PLAN, SHORTEN TIME CONNECTING INDIVIDUALS TO TREATMENT, INCREASE ACCESS TO BASIC NEEDS AND LENGTHEN AMOUNT OF TIME THE PERSON SUSTAINS RECOVERY. IN ADDITION, THIS PROGRAM INVOLVES AND EDUCATES FAMILY MEMBERS AND LOVED ONES AND CONNECTS THEM WITH THE INFORMATION AND/OR SUPPORT THEY REQUIRE. THE PROGRAM IS STAFFED BY TWO RCS AND IS SUPERVISED BY THE PENOBSCOT PLACE (PP) DIRECTOR. ALL NRCP STAFF ARE REQUIRED TO OBTAIN AND MAINTAIN THE PEER RECOVERY SPECIALIST (CPRS) CERTIFICATION THROUGH THE CONNECTICUT CERTIFICATION BOARD (CCB),AND/OR THE RECOVERY SUPPORT SPECIALIST (RSS) CERTIFICATION THROUGH ADVOCACY UNLIMITED. THE PENOBSCOT PLACE (PP) PROGRAM ALSO INCLUDES A COMPONENT FOR RC TRAINING AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR STAFF AND THE COMMUNITY AND FEATURES A CERTIFIED FACILITATOR FOR THE FOLLOWING CCAR RECOVERY COACH COURSES TO INCLUDE THE RECOVERY COACH ACADEMY AND ETHIC COURSES—BOTH NECESSARY COURSES FOR CERTIFICATIONS LISTED ABOVE. UTILIZING MOTIVATIONAL INTERVIEWING AND EMOTIONALLY INTELLIGENT-BASED COMMUNICATION SKILLS, NRCP STAFF BUILD TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS WITH THOSE SERVED, CONTINUOUSLY PROVIDING ASSERTIVE OUTREACH TO MEET PEOPLE ‘WHERE THEY ARE’, BY WORKING WITHIN THE COMMUNITY TO ESTABLISH A CONSTANT, CONSISTENT PRESENCE AND ENSURE CONTINUITY OF CARE FOR EVERYONE. STAFF BUILD MULTIDISCIPLINARY TEAMS, INCLUDING PRIMARY AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, CASE MANAGEMENT, AND PEER SUPPORT, AS WELL AS WORKING COLLABORATIVELY WITH EXISTING SUBSTANCE USE TREATMENT PROGRAMS AND REGIONAL RESOURCE PROVIDERS. ALL NRCP STAFF WILL BE UNIQUELY TRAINED IN ALL ASPECTS OF THIS SERVICE PROVISION. TO DATE, THE OVERALL PROGRAM HAS WORKED WITH 248 INDIVIDUALS STRUGGLING WITH AOD USE AND PROVIDED OVER 61% OF ITS PARTICIPANTS WITH TREATMENT OPTIONS—WITH NEARLY 88% ACCEPTING THE LEVEL OF CARE NEEDED. OVER 72% OF THE PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS ARE STILL ACTIVELY ENGAGING WITH AN RC AND THE PROGRAM HAS ALSO HELPED 76 FRIENDS/FAMILY MEMBERS WITH SUPPORT, NARCAN TRAINING, AND/OR LOCATE THE LEVEL OF SUPPORT NEEDED (NRCP OVERALL STATISTICS, 2021).THE NRCP, COUPLED WITH THE ROBUST NORWICH TASK FORCE (NTF), COMMUNITY CARE TEAM (CCT),AND COMMUNITY COLLABORATION HAS BEEN LARGELY RESPONSIBLE FOR A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN THE OVERDOSE SURVIVAL RATE IN NEW LONDON COUNTY OF 52% FOR THE COUNTY—AND 63% FOR NORWICH—MOSTLY DUE TO REGIONAL HELP, SUPPORT, TRAINING, AND DISTRIBUTION OF NARCAN COUNTY-WIDE(UHD, 2021). THE RATE OF OVERDOSE SURVIVAL OF COURSE DOES NOT INCLUDE THE NARCAN SAVES THAT HAPPEN IN PRIVATE RESIDENCES AND ARE NEVER REPORTED. FUNDING FROM THIS GRANT INITIATIVE WILL INCLUDE TWO RCS AND A PARTIAL DIRECTOR TO ENSURE COVERAGE OF ALL EASTERN CONNECTICUT. OFFICE LOCATIONS ARE ALREADY ESTABLISHED IN NORWICH AND JEWETT CITY. TECHNOLOGY SUCH AS LAPTOPS, HOT SPOTS, AND CELL PHONES ARE CRITICAL FOR ACCESS TO TREATMENT AND ACCESSIBILITY. FUNDING WOULD ALLOW THE 2 ADDITIONAL RECOVERY COACHES TO FILL THE SERVICE GAPS IN EASTERN CT AND EACH WOULD BE ASSIGNED COVERAGE AREAS BASED ON GEOGRAPHICAL LOCATION AND COMMUNITY NEED (AND MAY SHIFT AS THE NEED ARISES). USING A SIMILAR STRATEGY AS NORWICH, EACH RC WILL ESTABLISH COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS WITH LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, TREATMENT PROVIDERS, COMMUNITY PROVIDERS, AND FIRST RESPONDERS TO STRUCTURE A LOCAL “TASK FORCE” OR “ACTION TEAM”(IF NOT ALREADY PRESENT), SIMILAR TO THE CCT AND NTF CURRENTLY IN PLACE IN NORWICH.

MORGAN COUNTY PARTNERSHIP'S PREVENTION AND THERAPEUTIC SUPPORT INITIATIVE (PTSI) - THE MORGAN COUNTY PARTNERSHIP’S PREVENTION AND THERAPEUTIC SUPPORT INITIATIVE (PTSI) WILL SERVE MORGAN COUNTY PARTICIPANTS IN MORGAN COUNTY, WEST VIRGINIA, AGES 9 TO 20. THE MORGAN COUNTY PARTNERSHIP (MCP OR “THE PARTNERSHIP”) WILL BE THE LEAD ORGANIZATION ALONG WITH THE HELP OF COMMITTED PARTNERS. THE MORGAN COUNTY PARTNERSHIP’S MAIN FOCUS IS ON DRUG AND ALCOHOL PREVENTION. MORGAN COUNTY IS A COMMUNITY THAT HAS HIGH STUDENT POVERTY RATES (APPROXIMATELY 67% COUNTY-WIDE). THERE IS A HIGH PERCENTAGE OF YOUNG PEOPLE USING DRUGS AND ALCOHOL AT RATES HIGHER THAN THE NATIONAL AVERAGE. WITH A POVERTY RATE OF 15.8% (CENSUS), WHICH IS ALSO HIGHER THAN THE NATIONAL AVERAGE, THE PROBABILITY OF HEALTH AND SOCIAL RISK IS OF HIGH CONCERN. THE FIRST GOAL OF THE MCP’S PTSI PROGRAM IS TO REDUCE YOUTH SUBSTANCE USE, SPECIFICALLY AMONG YOUTH AGES 9-20, BY IMPLEMENTING EVIDENCED BASED PROGRAMS (EBP) AND PRACTICES IN LOCAL YOUTH-SERVING AGENCIES, THE SCHOOL SYSTEM, AND HIGHER EDUCATION. THIS GOAL WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES: OBJECTIVE 1: INCREASE THE AVERAGE AGE OF FIRST USE (YRS.) BY 5% MEASURED BY THE PRIDE SURVEY AND ASSET SURVEY, ALONG WITH OBJECTIVE 2: INCREASE PERCEPTION OF RISK OF ALCOHOL AND MARIJUANA AMONG YOUTH AND PARENTS BY 3%, AS MEASURED BY PRIDE SURVEY AND ASSET SURVEY. THE SECOND GOAL OF THE MCP’S PTSI PROGRAM IS TO STRENGTHEN THE COALITION’S INFRASTRUCTURE TO INCREASE ITS CAPACITY TO EFFECT POSITIVE COMMUNITY CHANGE BY PROMOTING THE COALITION’S PREVENTION AND INTERVENTION SERVICES AND PROVIDE TRAINING AND SUPPORT TO THE COALITION MEMBERS. THIS GOAL WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVE: OBJECTIVE 1: THE COALITION MEMBERSHIP WILL BE KNOWLEDGEABLE OF STRATEGIES TO PREVENT YOUTH SUBSTANCE ABUSE, AS MEASURED BY COALITION MEMBER SURVEY AND TRAINING ATTENDANCE LOGS. FROM THESE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES, WE HOPE TO EXPAND OUR CAPACITY ALONG WITH INCREASING THE FIRST ONSET OF USE OF SUBSTANCES AND REDUCING UNDERAGE DRINKING, USE OF MARIJUANA AND METHAMPHETAMINE. AT A MINIMUM, 3,000 PEOPLE WILL BE PART OF OUR EFFORTS OR BE AFFECTED BY OUR INITIATIVES. WE INTEND TO SERVE ALL SECTORS OF OUR COMMUNITY THROUGHOUT THE LIFE SPAN OF THIS GRANT.

CICERO TRAUMA INFORMED CARE (TIC) CONGRESSIONAL DIRECTIVE SPENDING PROJECTS - UI HEALTH -MILE SQUARE HEALTH CENTER (MSHC) TRAUMA INFORMED CARE AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH (BH) EXPANSION PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE MSHC CICERO CLINICTOOFFERIMMEDIATEACCESSTOWALK-INAPPOINTMENTSANDFOLLOW-UPCAREFORTHERAPY,ADDICTION,MENTALHEALTHEVALUATIONS,MEDICATIONMANAGEMENT,ANDCRISISINTERVENTION FOR PATIENTS WITH MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER NEEDS. AS PART OF THESE EFFORTS, MILE SQUARE WILL BROADEN ITS PATIENT NAVIGATION AND CARE COORDINATION TO OFFER MULTI-GENERATIONAL AND ADDICTION TRAUMA-INFORMED FAMILY-BASED CARE TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE CICERO COMMUNITY AND IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES OF THE FAMILIES IT SERVES. THIS MODEL WILL ADDRESS AND MITIGATE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND ADDICTION NEEDS IMPACTED BY SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH, AS WELL AS REDUCE OPIOID OVERDOSE RELATED DEATHS THROUGH THE PROVISION OF PREVENTION, TREATMENT, AND RECOVERY ACTIVITIES FOR OUD WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION. THE EXPANSION PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON SERVING THE MOST UNDER-RESOURCED COMMUNITY MEMBERS THAT RESIDE IN CICERO. CICERO/BERWYN HAVE THE HIGHEST UNINSURED RATE IN THE GREATER CHICAGO-LAND AREA, WHERE 14% OF RESIDENTS ARE UNINSURED COMPARED TO 10% IN CHICAGO AND ONLY 8% IN COOK COUNTY. THIS REGION HAS A HIGH PROPORTION OF IMMIGRANT POPULATIONS, MANY ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR MEDICAID OR FOR INSURANCE PREMIUM SUBSIDIES ON THE AFFORDABLE CARE ACT (ACA) STATE-FEDERAL PARTNERSHIP MARKETPLACE. CICERO HAS THE HIGHEST CONCENTRATIONS OF HISPANIC POPULATIONS (77%) OF ALL THE MSHC SERVICE AREAS. SINCE THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC LOCK DOWN IN MARCH 2020, COOK COUNTY HAS SEEN A STAGGERING INCREASE IN OPIOID RELATED DEATHS PER WEEK, AN AVERAGE OF 22.6 TO 43.4 (MMWR, 2021). TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY AND THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT MSHC WILL EXPAND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND ADDICTION SERVICES IN THE CICERO CLINIC AND ENHANCE EXISTING TREATMENT AND RECOVERY SUPPORT SERVICES TO ENSURE CONTINUED AND EXPANDED ACCESS TO MEET CRITICAL SERVICE GAPS IN THE COMMUNITY. THIS WILL BE DONE THROUGH INCREASED STAFFING, EXPANDED HOURS OF SERVICE (EVENINGS/WEEKENDS), AND WALK-IN AVAILABILITY. A MULTIDISCIPLINARY UI HEALTH PROFESSIONAL STAFF TEAM OF FAMILY AND ADDICTION PHYSICIANS, SOCIAL WORKERS, AND PATIENT NAVIGATOR/PEER RECOVERY SPECIALISTS, WILL BE FORMED TO PERFORM COMPREHENSIVE MEDICATION FOR OPIOID USE DISORDER (MOUD) AND RECOVERY SUPPORT SERVICES (RSS)AT THE MSHC -CICERO. THIS FUNDING WILL 1)EXPAND COMPREHENSIVE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH PROGRAM FOR INDIVIDUALS RESIDING IN OR NEAR THE CICERO COMMUNITY; 2) EXPAND TRAUMA-SPECIFIC MULTI-GENERATIONAL FAMILY AND CHILD MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES; 3) EXPAND AND ENHANCE A COMPREHENSIVE ADDICTION PROGRAM WITH OUTPATIENT TREATMENT FOR INDIVIDUALS RESIDING IN OR AROUND THE CICERO COMMUNITY; AND 4) DECREASE ILLICIT OPIOID DRUG USE AND PRESCRIPTION OPIOID MISUSE AT SIX-MONTH FOLLOW-UP. WITH SAMHSA FUNDING, MSHC WILL BE ABLE TO SERVE THE INDIVIDUALS THAT DO NOT HAVE MEDICAID OR PRIVATE INSURANCE AND EXPAND THESE NEEDED SERVICES TO ADDRESS THE STAGGERING RATES.

STUDENT RESILIENCY CENTER PROJECT - STARR COMMONWEALTH, FOUNDED IN 1913, PROVIDES COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS, EDUCATIONAL AND BEHAVIORAL AND HEALTH SERVICES, SPECIALIZED TREATMENT SERVICES AND PROFESSIONAL TRAINING AND COACHING TO HEAL TRAUMA AND BUILD RESILIENCE IN ALL CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, AND THE PROFESSIONAL THAT SERVE THEM. STARR'S PROGRAMS SERVE YOUTH, FAMILIES, SCHOOLS, AND COMMUNITIES AT SITES ACROSS MICHIGAN AND BEYOND. IN COLLABORATION WITH THE MARSHALL, BATTLE CREEK, LAKEVIEW, AND HARPER CREEK PUBLIC SCHOOLS, ALONG WITH THE BATTLE CREEK FAMILY YMCA AND CALHOUN COUNTY'S PUBLIC MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDER, SUMMIT POINTE, STARR LAUNCHED THE STUDENT RESILIENCE AND EMPOWERMENT CENTER (THE REC) IN SPRING 2022. THE GOAL OF THE REC IS TO SUPPORT AN ESTIMATED 150 UNDUPLICATED STUDENTS DURING THE YEARLONG PROJECT PERIOD, AND TO SUSTAIN THESE SERVICES THROUGH COMMUNITY-BASED RESOURCES. THIS IMMERSIVE PROGRAM INTEGRATES PUBLIC AND PRIVATE MENTAL HEALTH CARE INTO THE SCHOOL DAY, WITH SERVICES DELIVERED BY STARR AT THE YMCA. THE REC WAS CREATED IN RESPONSE TO GROWING LOCAL DEMAND TO MEET THE SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL AND MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS OF MIDDLE SCHOOL CHILDREN (GRADES 6-8) MORE EFFICIENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY. THIS IMMERSIVE PROGRAM DELIVERS SPECIALIZED SERVICES THROUGH STARR AT THE YMCA USING A SCHOOL-BASED REFERRAL AND CASE REVIEW PROCESS. THE REC WILL HAVE BOTH AM AND PM SESSIONS FOR UP TO 30 STUDENTS ENROLLED PER SESSION (60 STUDENTS PER DAY, 4-5 SESSIONS PER YEAR). THESE SERVICES WILL BE MEASURED AND OBJECTIVELY REPORTED THROUGH PRE- AND POST-ASSESSMENT OF A RANGE OF SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL, ACADEMIC AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH OUTCOMES/OBJECTIVES. THE RESULTS CAN BE REPLICATED BY OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS TO IMPROVE OUTCOMES FOR HIGH NEED POPULATIONS.   STARR COMMONWEALTH IS HEADQUARTERED IN ALBION, MICHIGAN AND HAS CAMPUSES IN BATTLE CREEK, KALAMAZOO, HARPER WOODS, AND AT THE CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL OF MICHIGAN IN DETROIT. OVER THE PAST 30 YEARS, STARR COMMONWEALTH HAS ALSO BUILT A SPECTRUM OF TRAUMA-RESPONSIVE PROGRAMS AND DIRECT (OUTPATIENT) BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES FOR CHILDREN, FAMILIES, SCHOOL SYSTEMS, HEALTHCARE SYSTEMS, AND COMMUNITIES. DURING THE FIRST YEAR START-UP PERIOD FOR THE REC, STARR AND ITS PROJECT TEAM WILL UTILIZE GRANT RESOURCES TO SERVE IN A LEADERSHIP ROLE AT THE REC BY PROVIDING PROJECT PLANNING OVERSIGHT, PROGRAM EVALUATION, TRAINING AND EMBEDDED SCHOOL SUPPORT STAFF, ALONG WITH CLINICAL OVERSIGHT AND THE STAFFING OF CLINICIANS, RESILIENCE COACHES, EDUCATION SPECIALISTS/TEACHERS, AND PROGRAM ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES. STARR WILL ALSO PROVIDE ITS OWN RESOURCES AND EXPERTISE TO HELP MARKET AND COMMUNICATE THIS PROGRAM AND THE STUDENT RESILIENCE AND EMPOWERMENT CENTER.

LIVING OUT SUCCESS - LIVING OUT SUCCESS IS A PROJECT THAT IS SUPPORTED BY THE FOLLOWING: FINANCE MANAGER, 2 MENTAL HEALTH CONSULTANTS, A YOUTH COORDINATOR SUPERVISOR, 2 YOUTH COORDINATORS, PROJECT DIRECTOR AND FRONT DESK ATTENDANT. THIS TEAM WILL WORK TOGETHER WITH LOCAL SCHOOLS, BUSINESSES, AND THE COMMUNITY TO PROVIDE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES TO YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES IN THE COMMUNITY. THE YOUTH COORDINATORS WILL DELIVER THE ASTRRONGU CURRICULUM WHICH ADDRESSES TOPICS SUCH AS ANXIETY, DEPRESSION, STRESS, PEER PRESSURE, HEALTHY RELATIONSHIPS AND SO MUCH MORE. THIS CURRICULUM FOCUSES ON PROVIDING YOUTH WITH CREDIBLE INFORMATION SO THAT THEY CAN BECOME COMMUNITY YOUTH LEADERS FOR THEIR PEERS.  THEY ALSO ASSIST WITH CAREER AND COLLEGE EXPLORATION. THE MENTAL HEALTH CONSULTANTS WILL BE SUPERVISED BY THE PROJECT DIRECTOR (LCSW) AND THEY WILL PROVIDE THERAPY TO YOUTH AND FAMILIES IN THE COMMUNITY. HOURS WOULD BE 9-5PM M-F. THEY WILL ALSO FACILITATE SUPPORT GROUPS FOR THE COMMUNITY.   WE PLAN TO PURCHASE ITEMS FOR THE SPACE SO THAT THE COMMUNITY CAN HAVE A CLEAN AND CALM SPACE. THIS WOULD BE A PLACE THAT WOULD ALLOW FAMILIES TO FEEL WELCOME AND SAFE. THE SUPPLIES WE PLAN TO PURCHASE ARE ITEMS SUCH AS PRINTERS, COMPUTERS, COPIER, ETC. WE WOULD LIKE TO HAVE READING MATERIAL FOR OUR FAMILIES AND NECESSARY SUPPLIES FOR STAFF. WE ALSO PURCHASE ITEMS FOR OUR HYGIENE CLOSET. OUR YOUTH HAVE ACCESS TO ITEMS SUCH AS LAUNDRY SOAP, TOOTHPASTE, TOOTHBRUSHES, SHAVING CREAM, LOTION, SHAMPOO, ETC. BASIC HYGIENE ITEMS ALLOW OUR YOUTH TO FEEL CONFIDENT IN THEIR EVERY DAY LIFE IN THE EVENT THEY MIGHT NOT HAVING SOMETHING AT HOME.   WE WOULD CONTRACT A LOCAL ARTIST AS WELL AS NUTRITIONIST TO ASSIST WITH OUR GROUPS AS WELL AS PROVIDE ACTIVITIES FOR YOUTH THAT REVOLVE AROUND HEALTHY HABITS AND LIVING WELL. WE HAVE CONTRACTED WITH THEM BEFORE AND THEY ARE ABLE TO CONNECT WELL WITH THE YOUTH AND PROVIDE SERVICES OUTSIDE OF THE SPACE IN A WAY THAT HELPS THE YOUTH FEEL CONNECTED TO THE COMMUNITY. THE ARTIST WILL FOCUS ON HELPING OUR YOUTH LEARN HOW TO DESTRESS WITH ART AND ALLOW THEM TO PAINT A MURAL IN THE AREA. THE NUTRITIONIST WILL GUIDE OUR YOUTH AND FAMILIES AND HELP THEM UNDERSTAND WHAT IS HEALTHY VS UNHEALTHY. SHE WILL ALSO HELP THEM LEARN HOW TO CREATE HEALTHY SNACKS AND MEALS WITH ITEMS THEY MAY HAVE AT HOME OR THAT THEY CAN PICK UP AT THE GROCERY STORE FOR A REASONABLE PRICE.   WE PUT SOME MONEY ASIDE FOR UTILITIES AND OCCUPANCY TO ASSURE THAT OUR PROGRAM HAS A SPACE SO THAT FAMILIES KNOW WHERE TO FIND US. WE SET ASIDE SOME MONEY FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT, IT SUPPORT, TRAINING AND EDUCATION, INDIRECT COSTS AS WELL AS SOME MISCELLANEOUS COSTS (BACKGROUND CHECKS, MUSEUM ADMISSIONS, HEALTH INSURANCE, BUSES, PAYROLL AUDITING, ETC.).   WE HAVE BEEN DELIVERING A WHOLISTIC PROGRAM FOR YOUTH FOR THE PAST 10 YEARS. WITH THIS FUNDING WE WILL HAVE A SPACE THAT WE CAN CALL OUR OWN, OUR FAMILIES WILL KNOW WHERE TO FIND US AND THEY WILL KNOW THAT WE ARE HERE TO PROVIDE THEM WITH BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES, HYGIENE ITEMS, WORKSHOPS, SUPPORT GROUPS AND REFERRALS. THEY WILL HAVE ACCESS RESOURCES THAT WILL ALLOW THEM TO FEEL EMPOWERED AND SUCCESSFUL.

CIDA (CENTER FOR INNOVATION AND DISCOVERY IN ADDICTIONS) MISSISSIPPI HORIZONS PROJECT - THE CENTRAL AIM OF THE CIDA MISSISSIPPI HORIZON'S PROJECT IS, ON A STATEWIDE BASIS, TO LEVERAGE UMMC'S EXISTING MENTAL HEALTH AND TECHNOLOGY CLINICAL EXPERTISE AND RESOURCES TO EFFICIENTLY FILL GAPS IN ACCESS TO CARE, ACCESS TO TREATMENT, AND AVAILABILITY OF EVIDENCE BASED TREATMENT.  UMMC, SPECIFICALLY THE CENTER FOR INNOVATION AND DISCOVERY IN ADDICTIONS (CIDA) AND THE DEPARTMENT OF PSYCHIATRY AND HUMAN BEHAVIOR, SEEKS TO FILL CARE GAPS BY PROVIDING EVALUATION AND LINKAGE TO SERVICES IN REAL TIME, WITH A FOCUS ON INCREASING AND IMPROVING ACCESS FOR PATIENTS IN RURAL AREAS. SPECIFICALLY, WE WILL:  1. OFFER 7 DAY/WEEK 7PM TO 7AM AVAILABILITY VIA OUR EXISTING TELEHEALTH INFRASTRUCTURE OF BOTH A LICENSED MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDE POSSESSING COMPETENCE IN SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS AND A LICENSED PEER SUPPORT SPECIALIST. EVENING AVAILABILITY OF SERVICES WILL COMPLEMENT TELE-BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONSULTATION PROVIDED DURING LIMITED DAYTIME HOURS. THIS CAPABILITY WOULD REDUCE UNNECESSARY TRANSFERS, ENSURE PATIENTS RECEIVE APPROPRIATE TREATMENT AND REDUCE THE OVERALL COST OF CARE FOR THESE PATIENT POPULATIONS.  2. FOR THOSE WITH OPIOID USE DISORDER, WE WILL PROVIDE IMMEDIATE AND SEAMLESS LINKAGE TO UMMC'S WELL-ESTABLISHED TELEMAT PROGRAM, AND FOR THOSE WITH ONGOING MENTAL HEALTH AND/OR SUBSTANCE ABUSE NEEDS, LINKAGE TO COMMUNITY RESOURCES.  3. STANDING UP A WEB BASED STATEWIDE PORTAL PROVIDING ACCESS TO ACCURATE, REAL TIME INFORMATION ON AVAILABILITY OF SUBSTANCE USE TREATMENT SLOTS. THIS PORTAL WILL PROVIDE TIMELY AND EFFICIENT ACCESS TO INFORMATION ESSENTIAL FOR REFERRAL AND APPLICATION FOR TREATMENT. SIMILAR FUNCTIONALITY HAS BEEN IMPLEMENTED IN KENTUCKY, DELAWARE, ALASKA, NEW MEXICO, AND SEVERAL OTHER STATES.  4. THROUGH CIDA'S ACADEMY OF ADDICTION TRAINING, WE WILL PROVIDE REGULAR EDUCATION AND TRAINING TO CLINICIANS, MEDICAL PROVIDERS, CONSUMERS AND THEIR FAMILIES ON TOPICS KEY TO IMPROVING ACCESS AND TREATMENT FOR THOSE WITH MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE DISORDERS.  IN SUM, UTILIZING EXISTING TELEHEALTH INFRASTRUCTURE AND EMPIRICALLY VALIDATED APPROACHES TO CARE, WE WILL IMPROVE PATIENT MANAGEMENT AND QUALITY OF CARE. TAKEN IN ITS TOTALITY, THIS PROPOSAL WILL FILL MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE ACCESS AND TREATMENT AGAPS ACROSS ALL OF MISSISSIPPI'S 82 COUNTIES.

VERMONT'S MENTAL HEALTH URGENT CARE INITIATIVE (MUCI) - BEHAVIORAL HEALTH NETWORK OF VERMONT, INC. DBA VERMONT CARE NETWORK (VCN) WILL SUPPORT FIVE OF ITS NETWORK AGENCIES IN THE INITIAL IMPLEMENTATION OF MENTAL HEALTH URGENT CARE INITIATIVES (MUCI) IN THEIR RESPECTIVE AREAS OF THE STATE. THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF MUCI IS TO SERVE YOUTH AND FAMILIES (AND ADULTS IN ADDISON COUNTY) EARLY IN THE CRISIS CYCLE TO AVOID FURTHER ESCALATION AND UNNECESSARY NEED FOR HIGHER LEVELS OF CARE. UNITED COUNSELING SERVICE OF BENNINGTON COUNTY (UCS), COUNSELING SERVICE OF ADDISON COUNTY (CSAC), LAMOILLE COUNTY MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES (LCMHS), HOWARD CENTER (HC) (CHITTENDEN COUNTY), AND HEALTHCARE AND REHABILITATION SERVICES (HCRS) (WINDHAM COUNTY), WILL DEVELOP URGENT CARE PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO MEET THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF THEIR COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE CONTEXT OF EXISTING SERVICES.    THE LACK OF NEEDED URGENT CARE RESOURCES FOR MENTAL HEALTH IN VERMONT HAS REACHED A CRISIS. EVEN BEFORE THE PANDEMIC LED TO INCREASED NEED AND REDUCED INPATIENT BED CAPACITY, ACUTE SHORTAGES OF OPTIONS FOR PEOPLE COPING WITH CRISES LED TO FREQUENT EPISODES OF EXTENDED EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT [ED] STAYS. INSPIRED BY THE SUCCESSFUL PEDIATRIC URGENT CARE FOR KIDS [PUCK] MODEL AT UCS, MUCI WILL INCLUDE AN EXPANSION OF PUCK IN BENNINGTON COUNTY, AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF FOUR ADDITIONAL URGENT CARE PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT VERMONT TWO OF WHICH WILL BE SIMILAR TO PUCK. MUCI WILL AIM TO ACHIEVE THREE PRIMARY GOALS: 1) PEOPLE PARTICIPATING IN MUCI PROGRAMS WILL DEMONSTRATE A DECREASE IN ACUITY OF REFERRING SYMPTOMS UPON DISCHARGE; 2) PEOPLE SUPPORTED BY MUCI PROGRAMS WILL REDUCE THEIR USE OF EMERGENCY DEPARTMENTS AND HOSPITALIZATION TO MANAGE MENTAL HEALTH CRISES; AND 3) PEOPLE IN THE MUCI PROGRAM WHO ARE ADMITTED TO THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT FOR MENTAL HEALTH CRISES WILL EXPERIENCE DECREASED LENGTHS OF STAY IN THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT. IN TOTAL, UP TO 335 VERMONTERS WILL BE SUPPORTED THROUGH THE INITIAL IMPLEMENTATION OF MUCI.

ACCESS MEDICATION ASSISTED TREATMENT PROGRAM ? DUPAGE COUNTY ENHANCEMENT - ACCESS COMMUNITY HEALTH NETWORK (ACCESS) IS ENHANCING MEDICATED ASSISTED TREATMENT (MAT) SERVICES IN DUPAGE COUNTY TO MEET THE NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME, VULNERABLE INDIVIDUALS WITH OPIOID ADDICTION AND DEPENDENCY. THE ENHANCED SERVICES AND PROGRAM FUNDED THROUGH THIS REQUEST WILL SERVE ACCESS WEST CHICAGO FAMILY HEALTH CENTER IN WEST CHICAGO AND ACCESS MARTIN T. RUSSO FAMILY HEALTH CENTER IN BLOOMINGDALE, BOTH IN DUPAGE COUNTY. ENHANCEMENTS WILL INCLUDE (1) INCREASED PROGRAM STAFF TO SUPPORT PATIENTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS EXPERIENCING SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER, (2) AUDITS OF OPIOID PRESCRIPTIONS ACCOMPANIED BY PROVIDER EDUCATION, AND (3) PROMOTION OF MAT SERVICES IN THE DUPAGE COMMUNITY.    OPIOID OVERDOSE AND MORTALITY RATES HAVE GROWN AT AN ALARMING PACE IN DUPAGE COUNTY OVER THE LAST DECADE. THE NUMBER OF DEATHS ATTRIBUTED TO OPIATE OVERDOSES IN DUPAGE COUNTY WAS CALLED A PUBLIC HEALTH EPIDEMIC IN 2013 BY THE DUPAGE COUNTY CORONER. IN 2016, THE NUMBER OF DEATHS IN DUPAGE DUE TO FENTANYL OVERDOSE INCREASED BY 100 PERCENT FROM 2015, AND DEATHS DUE TO A COMBINATION OF HEROIN AND FENTANYL INCREASED 370 PERCENT. THERE WERE 275 OPIOID-RELATED DEATHS IN DUPAGE COUNTY IN 20192. ACCORDING TO THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC), PRELIMINARY NATIONAL DATA FOR THE ONE-YEAR PERIOD ENDING IN NOVEMBER 2021 PREDICTS A 15.7 PERCENT INCREASE IN DRUG OVERDOSE DEATHS.    ACCORDING TO THE 2018 REPORT THE OPIOID CRISIS IN ILLINOIS: DATA AND THE STATE’S RESPONSE, DUPAGE COUNTY WAS AMONG THE ILLINOIS COUNTIES WITH THE HIGHEST NUMBER OF OPIOID-RELATED EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT VISITS WITH 410, AS WELL AS THE HIGHEST NUMBER OF HOSPITALIZATIONS WITH 178.    AT THESE SITES, OUR PATIENT POPULATION IS MAJORITY HISPANIC AND WHITE WITH 67 PERCENT OF PATIENTS IDENTIFYING AS HISPANIC AND 29 PERCENT IDENTIFYING AS WHITE IN 2021. OVER HALF OF PATIENTS SEEN AT THESE SITES USE MEDICAID FOR PAYMENT. ALL ACCESS SERVICES ARE AVAILABLE TO ALL PATIENTS, REGARDLESS OF THEIR ABILITY TO PAY. ACCESS SERVES APPROXIMATELY 695 UNIQUE PATIENTS ANNUALLY THROUGH ITS MAT PROGRAM USING AN INTEGRATED PRIMARY AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTHCARE MODEL.    THIS FUNDING WILL SUPPORT GREATER ACCESS TO MAT SERVICES FOR MORE DUPAGE COUNTY COMMUNITY MEMBERS THROUGH INCREASED PROGRAM STAFF, LOCAL OUTREACH AND EDUCATION, AND MORE NUANCED PROVIDER PRESCRIBING TRACKING AND ASSOCIATED GUIDANCE. BECAUSE FEDERALLY QUALIFIED HEALTH CENTERS SUCH AS ACCESS CAN BILL MEDICAID FOR THE MEDICATIONS AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES THAT ARE INTEGRAL TO A SUCCESSFUL MAT PROGRAM, THIS FUNDING WILL SUPPORT SERVICES FOR PATIENTS WHO ARE NOT MEDICAID-ELIGIBLE, OR SERVICES THAT ARE NOT MEDICAID-BILLABLE.  OUR MODEL INCLUDES A DESTIGMATIZED ENVIRONMENT IN A MEDICAL HOME SETTING, CULTURAL AND LINGUISTIC COMPETENCY WITH COMMUNITY-BASED STAFF, ACCESS TO ALL INDIVIDUALS REGARDLESS OF INSURANCE STATUS OR ABILITY TO PAY, AND INTEGRATED RISK REDUCTION AND EDUCATION TO PREVENT OVERDOSE.

CLINICAL AND EDUCATION EXPANSION OF SERVICES FOR THE INSTITUTE FOR ADVANCED DIAGNOSTICS AND THERAPEUTICS - SHEPPARD PRATT HEALTH SYSTEM, INC.’S PROPOSED CLINICAL AND EDUCATIONAL EXPANSION OF SERVICES FOR THE INSTITUTE FOR ADVANCED DIAGNOSTICS AND THERAPEUTICS PROPOSES TO SET UP A NEW EDUCATIONAL ARM, PROVIDING DURABLE, ACCESSIBLE UP TO DATE INFORMATION ON PSYCHIATRIC DIAGNOSIS AND TREATMENT, AND CREATING AN ESKETAMINE DOSING CLINIC FOR INPATIENTS AND OUTPATIENTS AT SHEPPARD PRATT. SHEPPARD PRATT’S POPULATION OF FOCUS FOR THIS PROJECT INCLUDE ADULTS WITH DIFFICULT TO TREAT MOOD DISORDERS AND CLINICIANS.     SHEPPARD PRATT SEEKS TO CREATE CONTINUING EDUCATION CURRICULUM FOR MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDERS BY FIRST IDENTIFYING THE 25 MOST CRITICAL TOPICS FOR MENTAL HEALTH CARE. SHEPPARD PRATT AND COMMUNITY EXPERTS WILL DELIVER A PRESENTATION ON EACH TOPIC.  THE MARKETING AND CONTINUING EDUCATION DEPARTMENTS WILL SHARE THESE FREE CME PROGRAMS ACROSS THE STATE OF MARYLAND.  BY THE END OF 1-YEAR, WE WILL HAVE A LIBRARY OF 25 TAPED LECTURES TO PROVIDE CME CREDITS TO REGISTERED CLINICIANS.  WE WILL SERVE 300 UNIQUE CLINICIANS WITH THIS SERVICE.   WE WILL PROVIDE WEEKLY ACCESS TO PRESCRIBERS THROUGHOUT MARYLAND TO ANSWER QUESTIONS ON DIAGNOSIS AND TREATMENT WITH A PROVIDER HELP LINE. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS, WE WILL IDENTIFY EXPERTS IN THE SHEPPARD PRATT SYSTEM CAPABLE OF PROVIDING TIMELY SUPPORT TO MARYLAND PRACTITIONERS AND DEVELOP A SCHEDULE FOR WHEN EXPERTS WILL BE AVAILABLE.  WE WILL ENGAGE WITH THE MARKETING DEPARTMENT AND PROVIDE COMMUNITY OUTREACH TO INFORM LOCAL PRESCRIBERS OF AVAILABILITY OF THIS NEW SHEPPARD PRATT SERVICE.  ONCE IMPLEMENTED, THE HELP LINE WILL GO LIVE WITH 10 HOURS PER WEEK OF EXPERT SUPPORT. WE WILL SERVE 100 UNIQUE CLINICIANS AND 500 UNIQUE PATIENTS OVER THE DURATION OF THE 1-YEAR FUNDING PERIOD.   SHEPPARD PRATT WILL PROVIDE ACCESS TO PATIENTS AND CLINICIANS TO GET IN PERSON OR VIRTUAL CONSULTATION WITH AN EXPERT CLINICIAN.  WE WILL ENGAGE WITH EXPERTS FROM EACH POPULATION SHEPPARD PRATT SERVES AND COLLABORATE WITH THEM TO PROVIDE TWO HOURS OF CONSULTATION SERVICE PER MONTH. TO SUPPORT SUSTAINABILITY, NEGOTIATIONS WILL BEGIN WITH THIRD PARTY INSURERS TO AGREE TO HIGHER CONSULTATION FEES FOR COVERED PATIENTS WHO HAVE REQUIRED FREQUENT SERVICES.  WE EXPECT THAT 200 UNIQUE PATIENTS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE CONSULTATION SERVICE.   WE WILL PROVIDE COMMUNITY ACCESS TO AN ACADEMIC CENTER QUALITY ESKETAMINE CLINIC PROVIDING BOTH EVALUATION AND TREATMENT. A SUSTAINABILITY FRAMEWORK WILL BE IMPLEMENTED BY NEGOTIATING A MUTUALLY ACCEPTABLE REIMBURSEMENT RATE WITH THIRD PARTY INSURERS. WE WILL EVALUATE TREATMENT OUTCOMES WITH STANDARD RESEARCH SCALES AND REVIEW AND MODIFY SERVICES BASED ON OUTCOMES AND PATIENT SATISFACTION. WE WILL SERVE 35 UNIQUE INPATIENTS AND 20 UNIQUE OUTPATIENTS WITH SERVICES OFFERED AT THE ESKETAMINE DOSING CLINIC.

CENTER WELLNESS AND RECOVERY - THE LESBIAN, GAY, BISEXUAL & TRANSGENDER COMMUNITY CENTER (THE CENTER), LOCATED IN MANHATTAN IN NEW YORK CITY (NYC), WILL IMPLEMENT A PROJECT, CENTER WELLNESS AND RECOVERY (CWR), TO IMPROVE THE MENTAL HEALTH OF LESBIAN, GAY, BISEXUAL, TRANSGENDER, AND QUEER OR QUESTIONING (LGBTQ+) NEW YORKERS OF MODEST MEANS AND TO REDUCE THEIR DISPARATE RATES OF SUBSTANCE USE. THE HIGHER RATES OF SUBSTANCE USE AND MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES AMONG LGTBQ+ PEOPLE HAVE BEEN ACCELERATED BY COVID-19. IN 2020, THE TREVOR PROJECT REPORTED THAT LGTBQ+ YOUTH WERE SIGNIFICANTLY IMPACTED BY PHYSICAL DISTANCING, ECONOMIC STRAIN, AND INCREASED ANXIETY, LEADING TO GREATER CONCERN ABOUT THE MENTAL HEALTH STRESSORS THAT CAN LEAD TO SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER (SUD). DURING THE PANDEMIC, THE DEMAND FOR CENTER SERVICES, ESPECIALLY MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELING AND OUTPATIENT SUD TREATMENT, INCREASED SIGNIFICANTLY. IN 2021, 26% OF PEOPLE UNDER AGE 30 REQUESTING SERVICES IDENTIFIED SUBSTANCE USE AS A CONCERN. OF THESE, 47% OF LGBTQ+ YOUTH IDENTIFIED SUBSTANCE USE AS A CONCERN, WITH 56% OF THESE IDENTIFYING MENTAL HEALTH DISORDERS AND/OR EXPRESSED SUICIDALITY; AND 51% OF TRANSGENDER AND GENDER NON-CONFORMING PEOPLE IDENTIFIED SUBSTANCE USE AS A CONCERN, WITH 72% IDENTIFYING MENTAL HEALTH DISORDERS AND/OR EXPRESSED SUICIDALITY.   LGTBQ+ POPULATIONS EXPERIENCE DISPARITIES IN ACCESS, SERVICE USE, AND OUTCOMES FOR SUD AND MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES. PROVIDERS NOT AFFILIATED WITH THE CENTER OFTEN LACK CULTURALLY SENSITIVE, TRAUMA-INFORMED TRAINING THAT ACKNOWLEDGES THE UNIQUE TRAUMAS EXPERIENCED BY LGTBQ+ PEOPLE, SUCH AS FAMILY REJECTION AND BULLYING, ASSOCIATED WITH DISCRIMINATION AGAINST THEIR GENDER IDENTITIES AND SEXUAL ORIENTATION. THIS DISCOURAGES MEMBERS OF THESE COMMUNITIES FROM GETTING HELP FOR SUD AND MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES AND INCREASES RISK FACTORS FOR SUBSTANCE USE. THE LACK OF TRAINING CAN STRAIN THE THERAPEUTIC RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN PROVIDERS AND PATIENTS, THEREBY INFLUENCING THE QUALITY AND APPROPRIATE DELIVERY OF CARE, AND DECREASING COMMITMENT TO TREATMENT, AN OUTCOME ALREADY NEGATIVELY AFFECTED BY STIGMA ASSOCIATED WITH PARTICIPATING IN MENTAL HEALTH AND SUD RECOVERY SERVICES.  THE GOAL OF CWR IS TO IMPROVE THE MENTAL HEALTH OF LGBTQ+ NEW YORKERS OF MODEST MEANS AND TO REDUCE THEIR DISPARATE RATES OF SUBSTANCE USE, MITIGATING THE IMPACT OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC ON THIS COMMUNITY THROUGH CULTURALLY COMPETENT MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELING AND SUBSTANCE USE TREATMENT THAT ADDRESSES THE UNIQUE CHALLENGES FACING LGTBQ+ PEOPLE. TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL, CWR WILL MEET THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES: 1) PROVIDE TREATMENT AND RECOVERY SERVICES FOR LGTBQ+ PEOPLE WITH SUD AND/OR MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES OVER THE ONE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, AND 2) INCREASE ENGAGEMENT OF LGTBQ+ PEOPLE IN THE CENTER'S MENTAL HEALTH AND SUD SERVICES BY UTILIZING HYBRID SERVICES AND EXPANDED OUTREACH STRATEGIES. CWR WILL SERVE 325 LGTBQ+ PEOPLE THROUGH TELEHEALTH AND IN-PERSON (HYBRID) MENTAL HEALTH TREATMENT, RECOVERY, AND PREVENTION PROGRAMS OVER THE GRANT PERIOD.

YOUTH RISING HOUSE - YOUTH RISING (YR) IS A NATIONAL 501C3 NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT HAS BEEN SERVING YOUTH LOCATED IN RURAL AND URBAN COMMUNITIES FOR 11 YEARS. FUNDING FOR THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW US TO PROVIDE RESIDENTIAL AND NON-RESIDENTIAL SUPPORT SERVICES FOR TRIBAL PREGNANT OR PARENTING YOUTH/YOUNG ADULTS AGES 12-21. YOUTH RISING WILL PROVIDE DROP-IN SERVICES IN DESCHUTES COUNTY (CENTRAL OR) AND THE YOUTH RISING HOUSE (YR HOUSE), A NEW TRANSITIONAL LIVING COOPERATIVE SHELTER IN DOUGLAS COUNTY (SOUTHERN OR), ADDITIONALLY ACCEPTING REFERRALS FROM SEVEN SURROUNDING COUNTIES IN THE REGION. THE NON-RESIDENTIAL SUPPORT SERVICES PROVIDED WILL CONSIST OF SERVICES COVERED UNDER THE NATIONAL YOUTH RISING MODEL. THIS INCLUDES DROP-IN CENTER SERVICES, GROUP PEER AND VIRTUAL PEER SUPPORT, PREVENTION PROGRAMS, APPLICABLE LIFE SKILLS TRAINING, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND INTERNSHIPS, AND ACCESS TO EDUCATION (GED OR ACCELERATED/SELF-PACED DIPLOMA PROGRAM). IN ADDITION TO ACCESS TO THE WELCOMED SERVICES LISTED ABOVE, RESIDENTS AGES 12-21 OF THE YR HOUSE WILL BE ACTIVELY SERVED THROUGH A PROGRAM FOCUSED ON TRIBAL YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS WHO ARE PREGNANT AND/OR PARENTING. EACH RESIDENT WILL RECEIVE 1:1 PEER SUPPORT FROM A PEER ADVOCATE WHO WILL EMPOWER AND ASSIST WITH ACCESS TO TRAUMA-ORIENTED SUBSTANCE ABUSE TREATMENT AND MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES. RESIDENTS WILL BE OFFERED GENDER-RESPONSIVE, TRAUMA-INFORMED SUBSTANCE ABUSE TREATMENT SERVICES THROUGH A COMPLETE CONTINUUM OF CARE AND FOR BREAKING THE CYCLE OF ADDICTION IN A CUTTING-EDGE, FORWARD-THINKING AND OUTCOMES-BASED APPROACH.

SANKOFA MENTAL HEALTH PROJECT - THIS PROJECT WILL SERVE 45 YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES WITH DIRECT MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES FROM AUGUST 1, 2022 - AUGUST 31, 2023. THE PROJECT WILL TARGET AFRICAN AMERICAN AND LATINO YOUTH AGES 13-18, WITH SMALL GROUP COUNSELING AND SUPPORT, WITH THREE COHORTS, TWO AT JENSEN ELEMENTARY SCHOOL AND ONE AT CHRIST THE KING JESUIT COLLEGE PREP, BOTH LOCATED ON THE WEST SIDE  OF CHICAGO, IL. THE COUNSELING WILL BE HELD TWICE PER WEEK, ONE 40-MINUTE AFTER-SCHOOL SESSION PER COHORT OF UP TO 15 STUDENTS EACH. FAMILY COUNSELING WILL BE HELD AT SANKOFA’S WEST SIDE FACILITY ONE SATURDAY PER MONTH FOR THOSE YOUTH AND FAMILIES NEEDING INDIVIDUAL SUPPORT. IN ADDITION, SANKOFA WILL HOST TWO SEMI-ANNUAL FORUMS FOR THE COMMUNITY AT-LARGE TO RAISE AWARENESS OF MENTAL HEALTH, DRUG PREVENTION AND TRAUMA SUPPORT, EACH TARGETED TO REACH AT LEAST 100 STUDENTS, PARENTS, AND COMMUNITY GROUPS. SANKOFA WILL SERVE THIS GROUP OF ADOLESCENTS, THEIR FAMILIES AND COMMUNITY RESIDENTS TO MITIGATE THE MENTAL HEALTH TRAUMAS RESULTING FROM COURT INVOLVEMENT, AND COMMUNITY, DOMESTIC, AND INDIVIDUAL VIOLENCE.

THE YOUTH MENTAL HEALTH COMPREHENSIVE GRANT WILL PROVIDE THE RESOURCES TO ACCELERATE THE GROWTH AND ACCESS TO CRITICALLY NEEDED STAFF PERSONS FOR YOUTH MENTAL NEEDS IN THE SUSQUEHANNA VALLEY REGION. - THIS PROJECT WILL BE GOVERNED BY THE GSVUW, WITH INPUT COMING FROM ITS SERVICE PROVIDERS, SCHOOL DISTRICTS AND THE INTERMEDIATE UNIT. THE ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF YMH WILL REPORT TO THE YMH DIRECTOR WHO WILL HAVE FULL OVERSIGHT IN ITS IMPLEMENTATION.   THE GOALS OF THE YOUTH MENTAL HEALTH COMPREHENSIVE PLAN AT GSVUW ARE MULTI-FACETED. OUR IMMEDIATE-TERM GOALS FOR THIS PROJECT ARE TO ELIMINATE BARRIERS TO MENTAL HEALTH CARE FOR CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS BY IMPROVING PBIS SUPPORTS AND IMPLEMENTING A TRAUMA-INFORMED APPROACH. WE HOPE TO ACCOMPLISH SEVERAL THINGS. FIRST, HIRING A FULL-TIME YOUTH MENTAL HEALTH EXPERT WHO WILL DO THE FOLLOWING: 1. PROVIDE CASE MANAGEMENT SERVICES TO CONNECT CHILDREN AND FAMILIES WITH DIAGNOSTIC AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES FOR ADVANCED-TIER PBIS REFERRALS; 2. FACILITATE ENROLLMENT OF ELIGIBLE STUDENTS WITH A MENTAL HEALTH DIAGNOSIS IN MEDICAID; 3. WORK WITH HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS AND COUNTY AGENCIES TO FACILITATE MENTAL HEALTH REFERRALS AND SUPPORT PARENTS/GUARDIANS; 4. IMPLEMENT TELEMEDICINE AND SCHOOL-BASED MENTAL HEALTH SOLUTIONS BY IDENTIFYING RESOURCES TO ALLOW FOR ADDITIONAL AND FREE/LOW-COST OPTIONS FOR SCHOOLS AND FAMILIES, ESPECIALLY THOSE PATIENTS WHO ARE UN- OR UNDERINSURED. 5. IMPLEMENT AND OVERSEE A FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM THAT WOULD PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR CO-PAYS AND OUT-OF-POCKET COSTS RELATED TO MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES. 6. WITH SUPPORT FROM OTHER GSV STAFF AND THE SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL WELLNESS TEAM FROM THE CENTRAL SUSQUEHANNA INTERMEDIATE UNIT (CSIU), IDENTIFY SCHOOLS WITH A HIGH NEED TO DEPLOY CONSULTANCY SERVICES FOR EVALUATING PBIS STRUCTURE AND IMPLEMENTING TRAUMA-INFORMED PROGRAMMING. THE SECOND MAJOR PIECE THE GRANT WOULD FUND IS A SUB-CONTRACT WITH A PATIENT ADVOCACY SPECIALIST WHO WILL ENROLL FAMILIES/CHILDREN IN MEDICAID. IN APRIL OF 2021, GSVUW HIRED A PART-TIME SPECIALIST AND IS ALREADY RECEIVING MANY REFERRALS AND COMPLETING ENROLLMENTS. THIRD, FUNDING WILL SEED THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FUND AND ENABLE US TO SEEK OTHER FUNDING SOURCES. FUNDING FROM MULTIPLE SOURCES HAS ALREADY BEEN COMMITTED TO SUPPORTING THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FUND. AND FINALLY, FUNDING WILL BE UTILIZED TO CONTRACT WITH CONSULTANTS TO EVALUATE AND IMPROVE SCHOOL PBIS STRUCTURES AND MOVE THEM TO A TRAUMA-SENSITIVE STRUCTURE. OUR OVERALL GOAL IS TO ELIMINATE ADOLESCENT DEATHS BY SUICIDE.  HIRING AN EFFECTIVE ASSISTANT DIRECTOR IS CRITICAL TO THE LAUNCH AND ULTIMATE SUCCESS OF THIS PROGRAM. THEN, WE WILL BEGIN THE IMPLEMENT PROCESSES AND SUPPORTS, INCLUDING FULL ASSET MAPPING, ESTABLISHING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE GUIDELINES, AND IDENTIFYING TARGET POPULATIONS FOR INTERVENTIONS. SCHOOL DISTRICTS WILL UTILIZE THEIR INTERNAL PROCESSES TO IDENTIFY STUDENTS WITH INDIVIDUALIZED MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS AS OUTLINED IN THE MOST ADVANCED PBIS TIER. STUDENTS ALREADY ENROLLED IN MEDICAID WILL HAVE A REFERRAL PLACED BY THE SCHOOL COUNSELOR, SOCIAL WORKER OR STUDENT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM TEAM TO A COMMUNITY CARE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH (CCBH) ORGANIZATION AND/OR SCHOOL-BASED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES DEPENDING UPON THEIR NEEDS. STUDENTS WITHOUT MEDICAID, BUT WITH A MENTAL HEALTH DIAGNOSIS WILL BE CONSULTED AND, IF SCHOOL-BASED SERVICES ARE DESIRED, CAN IMMEDIATELY BEGIN THE MEDICAID ENROLLMENT PROCESS. THOSE INTERESTED WILL BE CONNECTED WITH THE PATIENT ADVOCATE. STUDENTS WITHOUT MEDICAID AND WITHOUT A MENTAL HEALTH DIAGNOSIS, BUT WITH PBIS ADVANCED TIER NEEDS, WILL RECEIVE A WARM REFERRAL TO A DIAGNOSTIC PROVIDER. WHILE AWAITING A DIAGNOSIS OR ENROLLMENT INTO MEDICAID, STUDENTS, IF DESIRED, CAN BE REFERRED TO TELETHERAPY SOLUTIONS, ONCE IN PLACE. THIS THERAPY OPTION SEEKS TO ADDRESS THE NEED GAP BETWEEN WAITING TIMES OF DIAGNOSIS AND ENROLLMENT IN MEDICAID.

MENTAL HEALTH PEER SUPPORT PROGRAM - NAMI CHICAGO IS A 501C3 NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION AND ONE OF THE LARGEST, MOST ACTIVE AFFILIATES OF THE NATIONAL ALLIANCE ON MENTAL ILLNESS. SINCE 1979, WE HAVE FOUGHT FOR FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS IMPACTED BY MENTAL HEALTH CONDITIONS THROUGH PROMOTING COMMUNITY WELLNESS, BREAKING DOWN BARRIERS TO MENTAL HEALTH CARE, AND PROVIDING SUPPORT AND EXPERTISE FOR FAMILIES, PROFESSIONALS, AND INDIVIDUALS IN CHICAGO AND BEYOND.  NAMI CHICAGO IS A LOCAL LEADER IN PEER SUPPORT AND RECOVERY PROGRAMMING. WE EMPLOY THE PEER LEADERSHIP OF INDIVIDUALS LIVING WITH MENTAL HEALTH CONDITIONS AND SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS, AS WELL AS FAMILY MEMBERS AND LOVED ONES, WHO HAVE EXPERIENCE SUPPORTING A LOVED ONE'S MENTAL HEALTH JOURNEY. AT NAMI CHICAGO, PEER LEADERSHIP IS CENTRAL TO ALL THAT WE DO. A COHORT OF OUR PEER LEADERS WORK ON THE COLBERT CONSENT DECREE PROGRAM IN THE STATE OF ILLINOIS, SUPPORTING INDIVIDUALS TRANSITIONING FROM PSYCHIATRIC NURSING HOMES INTO INDEPENDENT LIVING. WE ALSO ORGANIZE PEER-LED RECOVERY SUPPORT GROUPS FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES, WHICH WE ARE CURRENTLY OFFERING VIA ZOOM CONFERENCE AND SELECT IN-PERSON OPPORTUNITIES. PEERS TEACH RECOVERY EDUCATION AT NAMI CHICAGO USING THE WRAP (WELLNESS RECOVERY ACTION PLAN) MODEL AND PROVIDE COACHING AND SUPPORT TO PEOPLE WHO CALL OUR MENTAL HEALTH HELPLINE. PEERS ALSO PLAY A CENTRAL ROLE IN OUR TRAINING AND EDUCATION PROGRAMMING, SHARING THEIR RECOVERY STORIES AND FACILITATING EDUCATION MODULES.  IN THE LAST TWO YEARS, NAMI CHICAGO HAS BUILT OUT A PEER TRAINING PROGRAM TO HELP DEVELOP A LARGER PEER WORKFORCE AND EXPAND OUR PEER PROGRAMMING. WE HAVE UTILIZED CONSULTANTS AND TRAIN-THE-TRAINER PROGRAMMING TO BUILD OWN OWN BEST-PRACTICE MODEL. AS NAMI CHICAGO BEGINS TO TRAIN MORE PEERS, WE ARE POISED TO THEN EMPLOY THEM AS INTERNS AND STAFF AND EXPAND THE FAMILY AND INDIVIDUAL PEER SUPPORT OPTIONS WE OFFER TO THE COMMUNITY. NAMI CHICAGO WILL ALSO PRIORITIZE ENGAGEMENT IN COMMUNITIES WITH HIGH RATES OF UNINSURED OR UNDERINSURED INDIVIDUALS, HIGH RATES OF TRAUMA AND RISK FACTORS, AND SIGNIFICANT BARRIERS TO ACCESSING MENTAL HEALTH CARE OUTSIDE OF THE CRISIS SYSTEM.  NAMI CHICAGO IS WORKING TO AMPLIFY THE AMOUNT OF INDIVIDUAL AND FAMILY RECOVERY PROGRAMMING AVAILABLE IN CHICAGO THROUGH BUILDING OUT OUR ONE-ON-ONE PEER COACHING PROGRAMING IN THE COMMUNITY - THIS PROGRAM CAN PROVIDE MENTAL WELLNESS SUPPORT TO SOME OF THE HARDEST TO REACH POPULATIONS BECAUSE OF THE UNIQUE WAY IT BREAKS DOWN POWER DYNAMICS AND BARRIERS OF UNDERSTANDING. THIS EXPANSION WILL ALSO ALLOW US TO STAFF INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILY PEERS ON OUR TELEPHONIC HELPLINE 7 DAYS A WEEK. PEERS WILL BE ABLE TO BEGIN RELATIONSHIPS WITH INDIVIDUALS IN NEED OF SUPPORT OVER THE PHONE, AND THEN TRANSITION THEM INTO IN-PERSON SUPPORT IN THE COMMUNITY WHEN NEEDED. THIS WILL ADD CRITICAL ADDITIONAL DEPTH TO OUR HELPLINE PROGRAM AND ALLOW US TO PROVIDE MORE COMPREHENSIVE SUPPORT.   EXPANDING THIS PROGRAM WILL HAVE SYSTEM-WIDE IMPLICATIONS - NAMI CHICAGO WILL INCREASE THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS LIVING WITH MENTAL HEALTH CONDITIONS WHO ARE ABLE TO FIND PAID WORK IN THE MENTAL HEALTH SPACE IN CHICAGO. THIS WILL INCREASE THE NUMBER OF MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONALS AVAILABLE TO PROVIDE SUPPORT IN A DIFFICULT TIME AND IMPROVE THE DIVERSITY AND CULTURAL COMPETENCY OF THE PEER WORKFORCE.

WHEELS AND WAVES: A STATEWIDE VIDEO DIRECTLY OBSERVED TREATMENT [VDOT] PROGRAM - WHEELS AND WAVES IS A VIDEO DIRECTLY OBSERVED TREATMENT [VDOT] PROGRAM THAT IS DESIGNED TO INCREASE ACCESS TO METHADONE AND BUPRENORPHINE DISPENSED FROM OPIATE USE DISORDER [OUD] TREATMENT PROGRAMS (KNOWN IN VERMONT AS “HUBS”) TO VERMONTERS WHO OTHERWISE ARE REQUIRED TO TRAVEL TO THE HUB SITE FOR OBSERVED DOSING. THROUGH WHEELS AND WAVES, PATIENTS ARE SUPPLIED WITH SECURE MEDICATION DISPENSERS AND A SMART PHONE VIDEO APP ENABLING THEM TO RECORD THEMSELVES TAKING METHADONE OR BUPRENORPHINE, AND THEN SUBMIT THE VIDEO FOR STAFF OBSERVATION. THE PROGRAM WAS SUCCESSFULLY PILOTED AT THE HOWARD CENTER’S CHITTENDEN CLINIC FROM 2016-2019, SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCING BARRIERS TO TREATMENT, INCREASING RETENTION RATES, INCREASING EMPLOYMENT RATES, AND REDUCING COSTS FOR THE PATIENT AND THE STATE. VERMONT CARE NETWORK WILL ADMINISTER THE SAMHSA GRANT ALLOWING THE WHEELS AND WAVES PILOT TO BE EXPANDED STATEWIDE MAKING VDOT AVAILABLE TO PATIENTS AT ALL 8 HUBS SERVING VERMONTERS.  THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF WHEELS AND WAVES IS TO INCREASE THE MAT RETENTION RATES OF UP TO 400 VERMONTERS WITH TRANSPORTATION AND EMPLOYMENT CHALLENGES WHO ARE ACCESSING METHADONE AND BUPRENORPHINE DISPENSED FROM HUB OUD TREATMENT PROGRAMS. THE STATEWIDE IMPLEMENTATION WILL SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING FOUR OBJECTIVES: 1) BY NOVEMBER 30 2022, VCN WILL HAVE TRAINED 8 HUBS IN THE REMOTE SUPERVISED DOSING MODEL; 2) BY SEPTEMBER 29 2023, HUBS WILL HAVE ENROLLED UP TO 400 UNIQUE INDIVIDUALS IN WHEELS AND WAVES AS MEASURED BY NUMBER OF PATIENTS WHO HAVE SUBMITTED AT LEAST OFF-SITE DOSING VIDEO TO THE HUB’S SECURE PLATFORM; 3) BY SEPTEMBER 29 2023, THE RETENTION RATE FOR MAT AT EACH HUB PARTICIPATING IN WHEELS AND WAVES WILL BE 10% HIGHER THAN THE PREVIOUS YEAR; AND 4) WITHIN THE 90-DAY CLOSE-OUT PERIOD, VCN WILL BE ABLE TO PROVIDE AVERAGE MONTHLY COST AND TIME SAVINGS FOR AT LEAST 200 VERMONTERS ENROLLED IN WHEELS AND WAVES.

SUBSTANCE USE TREATMENT PROGRAM PARTNERSHIP TO IDENTIFY, IMPLEMENT, AND BROADLY DISSEMINATE NEW FORMS OF SUD TREATMENT TARGETED TO UNDESERVED POPULATIONS. - THIS PROPOSAL WILL COLLECT PATIENT-REPORTED MENTAL HEALTH OUTCOMES AND BIOMETRIC ASSESSMENTS OF SLEEP AND CARDIOVASCULAR OUTCOMES FOR PERSONS IN SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER (SUD) TREATMENT. THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF THIS RESEARCH IS TO ESTABLISH A SYSTEM OF RIGOROUS PATIENT ASSESSMENT IN ORDER TO IMPROVE PATIENT CARE WITHIN THE ASHLEY, INC. OR ASHLEY ADDICTION TREATMENT (I.E., THE NAME BY WHICH SERVICES ARE DELIVERED), AND TO INFORM THE BROADER ADDICTION MEDICINE COMMUNITY OF BEST PRACTICES IN TRACKING TREATMENT OUTCOMES. SUBSTANCE USE IS A MAJOR PROBLEM IN THE UNITED STATES, INCLUDING THE DEADLY AND PROTRACTED OPIOID CRISIS AND AN EMERGENT STIMULANT CRISIS. THERE IS A GENERAL NEED TO IMPROVE SUD TREATMENT, YET THE MAJORITY OF SUD TREATMENT PROVIDERS DO NOT TRACK OR REPORT TREATMENT OUTCOMES. INCORPORATING PATIENT-REPORTED AND OBJECTIVE OUTCOMES INTO SUD TREATMENT HAS THE POTENTIAL TO IMPROVE TREATMENT DIRECTLY BY INFORMING CLINICAL STAFF OF PATIENT NEEDS IN REAL-TIME. COLLECTING THESE OUTCOMES CAN ALSO LEAD TO IMPROVED PHARMACOLOGICAL AND BEHAVIORAL STRATEGIES FOR AT-RISK SUB-GROUPS OF PERSONS WITH SUDS. DURING THE FUNDING PERIOD, THIS PROJECT WILL COLLECT DATA FROM 2,800 UNIQUE PATIENTS WITHIN THE ASHLEY ADDICTION TREATMENT SYSTEM, AND ESTABLISH THE INFRASTRUCTURE TO COLLECT LONGITUDINAL OUTCOMES. MENTAL HEALTH AND BIOMETRIC OUTCOMES WILL BE USED BY CLINICIANS IN REAL-TIME TO INFORM TREATMENT. THESE DATA WILL ALSO BE USED IN FUTURE ANALYSES TO EXAMINE FACTORS SUCH AS OPIOID- STIMULANT CO-USE AND ASSOCIATED MENTAL HEALTH TRAJECTORIES, RISK OF PERSISTENT/RECALCITRANT MENTAL HEALTH/SLEEP PROBLEMS, AND DRUG RELAPSE OUTCOMES. THUS, THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE PATIENT CARE DIRECTLY AND PROVIDE A RESOURCE TO THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY REGARDING THE RELATIONSHIP AMONG MENTAL HEALTH, SLEEP, AND DRUG USE OUTCOMES IN A REAL-WORLD SAMPLE FOR PERSONS IN SUD TREATMENT.

MERCY ZERO SUICIDE PROJECT - MERCY HEALTH MINISTRY’S (MERCY) PROPOSED MERCY ZERO SUICIDE PROJECT ADDRESSES THE NEED FOR EVIDENCE-BASED SUICIDE ASSESSMENT, CARE MANAGEMENT AND TRANSITIONAL SUPPORT FOR PATIENTS IDENTIFIED AS HAVING SUICIDE RISK IN THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT (ED) SETTING. THE PROJECT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED ACROSS THREE RURAL AND THREE URBAN MISSOURI HOSPITALS, SERVING 300 PATIENTS OVER THE AGE OF 13 ACROSS 7 COUNTIES. BY IMPLEMENTING A DIGITAL PLATFORM, THE PROJECT WILL STANDARDIZE AND IMPROVE THE CARE OF PATIENTS WHILE ADDRESSING CAPACITY CONSTRAINTS OF CURRENT ASSESSMENT PROCEDURES, SYSTEMATIZING WORKFLOW AND FOLLOW-UP, AND REDUCING THE IMPACT OF MENTAL ILLNESS ON MISSOURI COMMUNITIES. PROJECT PILOT SITES INCLUDE: MERCY HOSPITALS IN ST. LOUIS, JEFFERSON COUNTY, WASHINGTON, JOPLIN, SPRINGFIELD, AND LEBANON. THE PROJECT INTEGRATES A DIGITAL PLATFORM (JASPR) THAT WILL SIMULATE A CHAT WITH PATIENTS, ASKING QUESTIONS FROM EVIDENCE-BASED ASSESSMENTS, GUIDE THEM THROUGH SAFETY PLANNING AND LETHAL MEANS COUNSELING IN A CONVERSATIONAL MANNER, AND INTEGRATE THIS INFORMATION INTO THE PATIENT’S ELECTRONIC HEALTH RECORD. PATIENT SELF-REPORTS WILL BE MONITORED BY CLINICIANS AND REVIEWED WITH THE PATIENT TO AID IN APPROPRIATE DISPOSITION AND CARE PLANS. PATIENTS WILL ALSO HAVE ACCESS TO A LIBRARY OF COPING SKILLS AND VIDEOS FROM PEOPLE WITH LIVED EXPERIENCE TO HELP DECREASE DISTRESS DURING THE ED VISIT AND PROVIDE TRANSITION CARE SUPPORT THROUGH A MOBILE APP, JASPR-AT-HOME. JASPR WILL PROVIDE PEER SUPPORT TO FACILITATE PATIENT-USE, DELIVER TRAINING AND COACHING TO PROVIDERS, AND PROVIDE VIRTUAL OUTPATIENT SUPPORT FOR 30 CONCURRENT PATIENTS FOR UP TO 5 POST-DISCHARGE MEETINGS. THIS PARTNERSHIP INCLUDES THE EQUIPMENT, TRAINING, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE NEEDED TO IMPLEMENT A NEW SYSTEM. THE IMPLEMENTATION OF JASPR IS EXPECTED TO IMPROVE COMPLIANCE AND REDUCE COST AND LIABILITY WHILE EMPOWERING PATIENTS TO ADVANCE THEIR CARE AND PREVENT FUTURE SUICIDAL CRISES. GOALS AND OBJECTIVES INCLUDE: 1.	INCREASE MERCY’S CAPACITY TO PREVENT SUICIDE ATTEMPTS AND DEATHS BY INTEGRATING EVIDENCE-BASED INTERVENTIONS TO PROVIDE PERSON-CENTERED SAFETY AND SUICIDE-RELATED CLINICAL IMPROVEMENTS REDUCING OVERALL ASSESSMENT TIME BY 30 MINUTES; 2.	IMPLEMENT EVIDENCE-BASED TECHNOLOGY THROUGH STEERING COMMITTEES, CLINICAL AND OPERATIONAL WORK GROUPS, AND ED AND BH STAFF TRAINING. BY THE END OF THE PROJECT, MERCY WILL COMPLETE 50 ASSESSMENTS PER MONTH FOR SIX MONTHS AND INCREASE COMPLETION OF SAFETY PLANNING AND LETHAL MEANS COUNSELING TO 50% OF PATIENTS DISCHARGING FROM THE ED; 3.	EMPOWER INDIVIDUALS AT-RISK FOR SUICIDE TO STABILIZE, RECOVER FROM, AND PREVENT FUTURE SUICIDAL CRISES BY REDIRECTING THE USUAL ED WAIT TIME TO A LIBRARY OF COPING SKILLS TO REDUCE PATIENT DISTRESS AND AGITATION BY 30% ON A SELF-REPORTED 10-POINT SCALE BY THE END OF THE PROJECT; AND 4.	PATIENTS RECEIVING THE INTERVENTION WILL BE BETTER EQUIPPED FOR RECOVERY BY ENCOURAGING THE USE OF JASPR-AT-HOME MOBILE APP FOR CONTINUED ACCESS TO CONTENT AND UP TO FIVE VIRTUAL FOLLOW-UP MEETINGS WITH A PEER SUPPORT SPECIALIST. MERCY WILL REFER AT LEAST 50% OF PATIENTS USING JASPR TO AFTERCARE SUPPORT.  WE ANTICIPATE THE OVERALL IMPACT OF THIS PROJECT WILL ILLUSTRATE DIGITAL APPLICATIONS INCREASE ACCESS TO EVIDENCE-BASED PRACTICES AND HELP REDUCE SUICIDE ATTEMPTS AND DEATHS IN MISSOURI COMMUNITIES.

HEALTHY DEVELOPMENT COMMUNITY CLINIC: WELLNESS FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH, & FAMILIES - POPULATION THE HEALTHY DEVELOPMENT COMMUNITY CLINIC (HDCC) SERVES CHILDREN, YOUTH, AND FAMILIES IN SOUTH AND EAST SAN JOSE, CALIFORNIA. ACCORDING TO THE U.S. CENSUS BUREAU (2021), RESIDENTS OF THE CATCHMENT AREA PRIMARILY IDENTIFY AS 39% ASIAN, 25% LATINX, 3% BLACK OR AFRICAN AMERICAN, AND 4% WITH MULTIPLE ETHNORACIAL IDENTITIES. IN THE CITY OF SAN JOSE, 20% OF FAMILIES LIVE BELOW THE FEDERAL POVERTY LINE (FPL) INCLUDING 31% OF SAN JOSE CHILDREN. IN SOUTH SAN JOSE, 26% OF FAMILIES (AND 33% OF CHILDREN) RESIDE IN HOUSEHOLDS AT 185% OR MORE BELOW THE FPL (SANTA CLARA COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENT, 2018). ONE-QUARTER OF HOUSEHOLDS HAVE CHILDREN (0-17 YEARS; SANTA CLARA COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENT, 2018). FURTHERMORE, 39.7% OF SAN JOSE RESIDENTS ARE BORN OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES (U.S. CENSUS, 2021), AND 56% OF HOUSEHOLDS REPORT SPEAKING A HOME LANGUAGE OTHER THAN ENGLISH (SANTA CLARA COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENT, 2018). COLLECTIVELY, THESE NUMBERS HIGHLIGHT THE MULTIPLE COMMUNITIES WHO MAY EXPERIENCE LANGUAGE, CULTURAL, AND SYSTEMIC BARRIERS TO CARE.   SERVICES THE PURPOSE OF THE HEALTHY DEVELOPMENT COMMUNITY CLINIC (HDCC) IS TO PROMOTE EQUITY THROUGH HOLISTIC WELLNESS FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH, AND FAMILIES. THROUGH PRIMARY PREVENTION AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION, THE HDCC BUILDS ON INDIVIDUAL, FAMILY, AND COMMUNITY STRENGTHS; CONNECTS FAMILIES WITH EXISTING RESOURCES; AND PROVIDES CULTURALLY- AND LINGUISTICALLY-RESPONSIVE, TRAUMA-INFORMED SERVICES TO MEET THE WIDE-RANGING NEEDS OF CHILDREN, YOUTH, AND FAMILIES. THE HDCC USES AN INTERDISCIPLINARY, TEAM-BASED APPROACH TO LEAD SERVICES THROUGH SCREENINGS, SHORT-TERM INTERVENTIONS, OUTREACH AND EDUCATION, AND TARGETED REFERRALS. SERVICES ADDRESS MENTAL HEALTH, SPEECH AND LANGUAGE, ACADEMIC AND SOCIAL SUCCESS, AND PARENT/FAMILY EDUCATION. EXAMPLES OF SERVICES INCLUDE MENTAL HEALTH, DEVELOPMENTAL, ORAL, HEARING, AND SPEECH AND LANGUAGE SCREENINGS; BRIEF PSYCHOTHERAPY, PSYCHOSOCIAL EDUCATIONAL GROUPS (E.G., COPING SKILLS TO MANAGE ANXIETY, SOCIAL SKILLS FOR HEALTHY RELATIONSHIPS), PARENT AND FAMILY PSYCHOEDUCATION; COMMUNITY WELLNESS EVENTS, AND REFERRALS AND RECOMMENDATIONS FOR COMMUNITY SERVICES.   SERVICES ARE PROVIDED BY STUDENT CLINICIANS AND SUPERVISED BY SAN JOSE STATE UNIVERSITY FACULTY AND LICENSED PROVIDERS; THUS, IN ADDITION TO SERVING THE COMMUNITY, THE HDCC IS ALSO TRAINING THE NEXT GENERATION OF MENTAL HEALTH AND HEALTH PROVIDERS.    COORDINATION  THE HDCC IS COMMITTED TO COORDINATED EFFORTS WITH STATE AND LOCAL HEALTH ORGANIZATIONS TO COLLABORATIVELY ADDRESS HEALTH EQUITY AND COORDINATE CARE. EXTENSIVE AND ONGOING CONVERSATIONS REGARDING FORMAL PROCESSES TO MORE EFFECTIVELY COORDINATE CARE CONTINUE TO EVOLVE. LOCAL AGENCIES SEEKING TO COLLABORATE WITH THE HDCC INCLUDE LOCAL COUNTY COMMUNITY HEALTH ORGANIZATIONS, NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS FOCUSED ON CHILD HEALTH SCREENINGS AND PARENT SUPPORT, COUNTY HEALTH AND EDUCATION LEADERS, AND MOBILE HEALTH SERVICES WHO ARE ABLE TO BRING BRIEF SERVICES INTO THE COMMUNITY.

PROJECT RECOVERY WILL PROVIDE A DIRECT AND IMMEDIATE PATH TO TREATMENT FOR PEOPLE SUFFERING FROM A SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER. - PROJECT NAME:  PROJECT RECOVERY  POPULATION TO BE SERVED:  CITIZENS OF AUGUSTA NEEDING SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER TREATMENT AND RECOVERY SERVICES.  SUMMARY:  PROJECT RECOVERY WILL PROVIDE A DIRECT AND IMMEDIATE PATH TO TREATMENT FOR PEOPLE SUFFERING FROM A SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER. INDIVIDUALS SEEKING TREATMENT CAN WALK INTO AN AUGUSTA FIRE STATION AND REQUEST AN ASSESSMENT FOR ADMISSION INTO PROJECT RECOVERY. THE PROJECT RECOVERY PROGRAM DIRECTOR WILL WORK WITH INDIVIDUALS IDENTIFIED WITH SUD TREATMENT NEEDS TO DETERMINE THE BEST COURSE TO ACCESS THE APPROPRIATE TREATMENT RESOURCES. THE PROGRAM DIRECTOR AND TRAINED VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH THE INDIVIDUAL THROUGH THE TREATMENT PROCESS, HELP HIM OR HER WITH REINTEGRATION INTO THE COMMUNITY, AND PROVIDE FOLLOW UP TO TRACK PROGRESS, OFFER RESOURCES, AND COLLECT DATA ON PROGRAM OUTCOMES.

GRASSROOTS OUTPATIENT MENTAL HEALTH CLINIC - GRASSROOTS CRISIS INTERVENTION CENTER IS SEEKING SUPPORT FOR 1 YEAR OF OPERATING FUNDS TO OPEN AN OUTPATIENT MENTAL HEALTH CLINIC (OMHC) IN COLUMBIA, MARYLAND. GRASSROOTS IS HOWARD COUNTY’S ONLY 24-HOUR CRISIS CENTER AND PROVIDES 24-HOUR TELEPHONE CRISIS COUNSELING, FREE WALK-IN CRISIS COUNSELING, MOBILE CRISIS TEAM, AND SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER SCREENING AND CRISIS STABILIZATION FOR OPIOID AND STIMULANT USE DISORDERS. THE OUTPATIENT MENTAL HEALTH CLINIC WOULD PROVIDE SAME DAY ACCESS TO BEHAVIORAL HEALTH TREATMENT FOR INDIVIDUALS EXPERIENCING MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS CRISIS IN OUR COMMUNITY.  HOWARD COUNTY HAS LIMITED SAME DAY ACCESS PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDE URGENT CARE TO INDIVIDUALS EXPERIENCING BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CRISIS.  THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT IS INUNDATED WITH INDIVIDUALS SEEKING BEHAVIORAL HEALTH RELIEF DUE TO INABILITY TO ACCESS MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDERS WHILE IN CRISIS. THE NEW CLINIC WOULD PROVIDE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ASSESSMENTS, INDIVIDUAL AND GROUP PSYCHOTHERAPY, PSYCHIATRIC SERVICES, CASE MANAGEMENT RESOURCES, AND PSYCHOEDUCATION SERVICES. THROUGH THE YEARS WE HAVE SEEN AN INCREASED NEED FOR A COMPREHENSIVE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CENTER.  APPROXIMATELY 60% OF THOSE SEEKING WALK-IN SERVICES PRESENT WITH A MENTAL HEALTH DISORDER. ANOTHER 20% OF CLIENTS ARE SEEKING HELP FOR A SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER. ABOUT 19% OF THOSE WE SERVE ARE EXPERIENCING SUICIDAL IDEATION.  APPROXIMATELY 75% OF ALL CLIENTS ARE EXPERIENCING CO-OCCURRING DISORDERS MEANING THAT THEY IN NEED OF SUPPORT OR TREATMENT FOR A MENTAL HEALTH ISSUE (INCLUDING SUICIDAL IDEATION) AND A SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER.  AT GRASSROOTS WE CAN PROVIDE TREATMENT FOR THE SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS AND IMMEDIATE CRISIS, HOWEVER, THERE IS SIGNIFICANT NEED TO ADDRESS ALL ASPECTS OF THE INDIVIDUAL’S CRISIS NEEDS. BY BEING ABLE TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES WE WILL INCREASE ACCESS TO CARE AND INCREASE THE LIKELIHOOD OF RECOVERY.  INDIVIDUALS WITH SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS HAVE A HIGH RATE OF RELAPSE DUE TO ONGOING UNDERLYING ISSUES. BY OFFERING MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER TREATMENT, GRASSROOTS WILL BE PROVIDING FULL SERVICES AND BE ABLE TO ADDRESS ALL CLIENT’ NEEDS.

MENTAL HEALTH URGENT CARE CENTER TO PROVIDE ACCESS TO MENTAL HEALTH CRISIS CARE - THE CITIES OF DUBLIN, LIVERMORE, AND PLEASANTON ALONG WITH THE COUNTY OF ALAMEDA HAVE PARTNERED WITH AXIS COMMUNITY HEALTH TO ESTABLISH AXIS BRIDGE, A MENTAL HEALTH URGENT CARE CENTER. AXIS BRIDGE IS A NEW, INNOVATIVE SOLUTION WHICH SERVICES AS A CENTRAL ENTRY POINT FOR ASSESSMENT, TRIAGE, TREATMENT, AND CARE COORDINATION FOR ANYONE SEEKING MENTAL HEALTH TREATMENT, REGARDLESS OF INCOME LEVEL, INSURANCE TYPE OR STATUS, AND RESIDENCY WITHIN ALAMEDA COUNTY. LIKE A MEDICAL URGENT CARE SETTING, THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ASSESSMENT AND TIMELY CONNECTION TO SERVICES--IN A SETTING THAT IS LESS COSTLY THAN AN EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT. INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WITH URGENT MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS ARE ABLE TO CALL FOR SAME-DAY OR NEXT DAY APPOINTMENTS. DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, SERVICES HAVE BEEN PROVIDED VIA TELEHEALTH; LONG-TERM PLANS INCLUDE A WALK-IN ACCESS POINT AS WELL. AXIS BRIDGE PATIENTS ARE ASSESSED TO DETERMINE WHERE THEIR CONDITION FALLS IN THE DIAGNOSTIC RANGE THAT INCLUDES: 1) MILE TO MODERATE, 2) MODERATE, OR 3) SEVERE. TYPICALLY, THE MAJORITY OF PATIENTS IN A COMMUNITY SETTING ARE IN THE MILD TO MODERATE RANGE. THE VAST MAJORITY OF PATIENTS IN A COMMUNITY SETTING ARE TREATABLE BY PROGRAM STAFF. A SMALL PERCENTAGE REQUIRE MEDICATION PRIOR TO BEING ABLE TO BENEFIT FROM TREATMENT, AND UNDER THE GUIDANCE OF THE PROGRAM'S PSYCHIATRIST ARE REFERRED TO HIGHER LEVELS OF CARE. STAFF UTILIZE MENTAL HEALTH SCREENING TOOLS, CONDUCT BIO-PSYCHOSOCIAL DIAGNOSTIC ASSESSMENTS AND PROVIDE BRIEF COUNSELING AND TRAUMA TREATMENT. AXIS BRIDGE STAFF HAVE THE ABILITY TO CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS FOR PATIENTS PRESENTING WITH SUICIDAL THINKING AND ARE ABLE TO DEESCALATE AND ARE FREQUENTLY ABLE TO AVERT 5150S (INVOLUNTARY 72-HOUR PSYCHIATRIC HOSPITALIZATIONS). THE PROVIDERS ARE EXPERIENCED AT INTERVENING WHEN SUICIDAL THOUGHTS ARE PRESENTED, AND MOST OFTEN, FOLLOWING CAREFUL ASSESSMENT AND DEVELOPMENT OF A SAFETY PLAN, A 5150 IS AVOIDED. PSYCHIATRIC CARE IS PROVIDED VIA TELEHEALTH FOR PATIENTS THAT REQUIRE MEDICATION MANAGEMENT. THE PSYCHIATRIST PRESCRIBES FOR PATIENTS ENROLLED IN MEDI-CAL PLANS; PATIENTS WITH OTHER INSURANCES ARE REFERRED TO THEIR PROVIDERS FOR MEDICATION. EVEN FOR PATIENTS WHO ARE MEDICATION-RESISTANT, WHICH IS FREQUENTLY THE CASE, A VISIT TO AXIS BRIDGE HELPS PAVE THE WAY FOR SUCH INTERVENTION IN THE FUTURE. LIKE MEDICAL URGENT CARE, STAFF SEE PATIENTS WITH AN IMMEDIATE NEED, AND ASSIST IN COORDINATING CARE THAT CONNECTS PATIENTS (AND FAMILIES) TO ONGOING CARE WITH A PROVIDER AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SUPPORT RESOURCES APPROPRIATE TO THEIR NEEDS FOR LONGER TERM CARE. THE DIRECT SERVICE LINE FOR AXIS BRIDGE IS COMMUNICATED TO KEY COMMUNITY PARTNERS, SUCH AS LOCAL POLICE DEPARTMENTS, SAFETY NET ORGANIZATIONS, AND SCHOOL SOCIAL SERVICES STAFF, AS WELL AS THE GENERAL PUBLIC. AXIS BRIDGE HAS ALSO ESTABLISHED A DIRECT MESSAGING SYSTEM WITH THE LOCAL COMMUNITY HOSPITAL, STANFORD HEALTHCARE--VALLEYCARE THAT ALLOWS REFERRALS TO COME DIRECTLY FROM THEIR EMERGENCY ROOM TO AXIS BRIDGE FOR SAME DAY OR NEXT DAY FOLLOW-UP AS NEEDED. DURING ITS FIRST YEAR, AXIS BRIDGE MAINTAINED SERVICES VIA TELEHEALTH DUE TO THE COVID HEALTH CRISIS. SHOULD HEALTH CONDITIONS ALLOW, AXIS WILL BE ABLE TO OFFER A HYBRID MODEL OF TELEHEALTH AND IN-PERSON SERVICES, WHICH WILL PROVIDE PATIENTS GREATER ACCESS FLEXIBILITY. AXIS BRIDGE WILL ALSO EXPLORE OPTIONS FOR EXPANDING SERVICES TO A WIDER GEOGRAPHIC AREA, TO POTENTIALLY INCLUDE CITIES IN THE SOUTH PORTION OF CONTRA COSTA COUNTY. AXIS BRIDGE PROVIDES 25-30 CARE COORDINATION VISITS PER WEEK, AND AN ESTIMATED 15-20 COUNSELING VISITS PER WEEK. APPROXIMATELY 500 UNIQUE PATIENTS WERE SERVED IN YEAR ONE.

THE ARISE INITIATIVE, PROVIDING SUPPORT TO THOSE IN RECOVERY OR WITH A HISTORY OF INCARCERATION TO RE-ENTER THE WORKFORCE IN THE FRANKLIN COUNTY AND THE NORTH QUABBIN REGION OF WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS. - THROUGH EXTENSIVE TRAUMA-INFORMED STRATEGIES SUCH AS CASE MANAGEMENT, WRAP-AROUND SERVICES (E.G. TRANSPORTATION, CHILDCARE), SKILL-BUILDING WORKSHOPS, COACHING, AND PEER MENTORING, THE ARISE INITIATIVE WILL SUPPORT INDIVIDUALS IN RECOVERY FROM ALCOHOL, OPIOID AND/OR OTHER DRUG MISUSE TO RE-ENTER THE WORKFORCE IN THE 30 RURAL COMMUNITIES OF FRANKLIN COUNTY AND THE NORTH QUABBIN REGION OF WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS. TAILORED EMPLOYMENT, TRAINING, AND ENTREPRENEURIAL OPPORTUNITIES AND SUPPORTS WILL ALSO BE OFFERED FOR THIS OVERLOOKED SEGMENT OF THE WORKFORCE, WHO ARE CURRENTLY UNDERSERVED OR IGNORED BY EXISTING EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING SYSTEMS SO THAT THEY CAN BECOME CONTRIBUTING MEMBERS OF THE WORKFORCE, PROVIDE FOR THEMSELVES, AND THEIR FAMILIES, AND CONTINUE UPON A PATH OF SELF-SUFFICIENCY.  THE ARISE INITIATIVE WILL SERVE 40 ADULTS DURING THE GRANT PERIOD WHO ARE IN RECOVERY AND ARE IN NEED OF CASE MANAGEMENT AND OTHER SUPPORTS TO SUPPORT THEIR EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING PATHWAYS. SPECIAL CONSIDERATION WILL ALSO BE PROVIDED TO VETERANS, PARENTS IN RECOVERY, YOUNG ADULTS, AND SINGLE HEADS OF HOUSEHOLDS.  THE ARISE INITIATIVE HAS EIGHT GOALS: 1) OFFER SKILL-BUILDING WORKSHOPS IN LIFE SKILLS, WORKFORCE READINESS, CONFLICT RESOLUTION, MAINTAINING RECOVERY IN WORKPLACE SETTINGS, WORKPLACE CULTURE, AND NORMS FOR INDIVIDUALS IN RECOVERY AND/OR WITH A HISTORY OF INCARCERATION; 2) OFFER WORKSHOPS FOR EMPLOYERS TO ADDRESS THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF INDIVIDUALS IN RECOVERY AND/OR THOSE WITH A HISTORY OF INCARCERATION; 3) HOLD CAREER FAIRS FOR INDIVIDUALS IN RECOVERY AND/OR THOSE WITH A HISTORY OF INCARCERATION; 4) OFFER INDIVIDUALIZED EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING ASSESSMENTS; 5) TAILOR EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES CREATED FOR INDIVIDUALS IN RECOVERY; 6) PLACE INDIVIDUALS IN JOBS IN ONE OR MORE OF THE SEVEN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT CLUSTER AREAS IDENTIFIED BY LOCAL DATA: 7) PROVIDE FOLLOW-UP VISITS ONCE INDIVIDUALS IN RECOVERY ARE PLACED IN A JOB; AND 8) DEVELOP PEER MENTORING NETWORKS AND SUPPORTS TO MAXIMIZE THEIR JOB SUCCESS.  TO CREATE THE ARISE INITIATIVE, THE FRANKLIN COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE, IN COLLABORATION WITH THE OPIOID TASK FORCE OF FRANKLIN COUNTY AND THE NORTH QUABBIN REGION, GREENFIELD COMMUNITY COLLEGE, THE GARDNER ATHOL AREA MENTAL HEALTH ASSOCIATION, AND THE MASSHIRE FRANKLIN HAMPSHIRE WORKFORCE BOARD, IS SEEKING $200,000 TO IMPLEMENT THIS ONE-YEAR EFFORT.

TRAUMA INFORMED PRACTICE AND PRESCHOOL SUPPORTS (TIPPS) - TRAUMA-INFORMED PRACTICE AND PRESCHOOL SUPPORTS (TIPPS): AN ATTACHMENT-CENTERED, TRAUMA-INFORMED, EQUITY-ADVANCING, TEAM-BASED CARE MODEL FOR CHILDREN FROM BIRTH TO 12 WITH SIGNIFICANT MENTAL HEALTH COMPLICATIONS AND THEIR FAMILIES, ALONG WITH AN EARLY CHILDHOOD WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PILOT TO SUPPORT PRESCHOOL CLASSROOMS FACING ADVERSITY.  TIPPS IS A COLLABORATION OF THE REGINALD S. LOURIE CENTER FOR INFANTS AND YOUNG CHILDREN (LC), A LEADING EARLY CHILDHOOD MENTAL HEALTH (ECMH) AND A SPECIAL EDUCATION CENTER, MONTGOMERY COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES (MCDHHS) AND PROJECT ECHO (EXTENSION FOR COMMUNITY HEALTHCARE OUTCOMES). THE TIPPS PROJECT AIMS TO PROVIDE SPECIALIZED EARLY CHILDHOOD MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES TO INFANTS AND YOUNG CHILDREN AGES BIRTH TO 12 AND THEIR FAMILIES IN MONTGOMERY COUNTY AND ADJOINING COUNTIES, SUCH AS PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY, WHO ARE FACING A RANGE OF EMOTIONAL AND BEHAVIORAL DISORDERS SEVERELY AFFECTING THEIR ABILITY TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN: SCHOOL AND CHILDCARE SETTINGS, HOMES. AND COMMUNITY.  A SECOND COMPONENT OF TIPPS WILL PROVIDE SPECIAL EDUCATION ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS WITH POSITIVE BEHAVIORAL INTERVENTIONS AND SUPPORTS (PBIS) TO HELP REDUCE LEARNING DISRUPTION AND UNSAFE BEHAVIORS.  THE THIRD COMPONENT OF TIPPS WILL BE TO PILOT EARLY CHILDHOOD MENTAL HEALTH TELE-CONSULTATION AND MENTORING PROJECTS WITH EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATORS IN PRESCHOOL SETTINGS THROUGH PROJECT ECHO WITH SEVERAL SITES ACROSS THE COUNTRY.  PRIOR TO COVID, THIS POPULATION WAS ALREADY AT A HIGHER RISK FOR SERIOUS EMOTIONAL DISTURBANCE DUE TO EXPOSURE TO TRAUMATIC EXPERIENCES - PAST AND PRESENT - THAT STRESSED THE CAREGIVER-CHILD RELATIONSHIP WHICH FUNCTIONS TO FUEL HEALTHY DEVELOPMENT.  THESE FAMILIES ARE VULNERABLE TO THE WELL-DOCUMENTED, LONG-TERM CONSEQUENCES OF ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES.  CHILDREN'S ECMH CHALLENGES INCLUDE TRAUMA, ANXIETY, DEPRESSION, ATTACHMENT PROBLEMS, ATTENTION DEFICIT, SOCIAL SKILL DEFICITS, AND DISRUPTIVE DISORDERS. COVID AND RACIAL INJUSTICE HAVE EXACERBATED FAMILY STRESSORS AND INEQUITIES, INCLUDING LACK OF IN-PERSON EDUCATION AND INCREASED SOCIAL ISOLATION, RESULTING IN CONCERNING STRESS LEVELS IN CHILDREN AND CAREGIVERS.  AT LEAST 80% OF CHILDREN WILL BE MEDICAID-ELIGIBLE FROM MONTGOMERY COUNTY, MARYLAND AND NEARBY COUNTIES.  THE MAJORITY OF TIPPS PARTICIPANTS WILL BE FROM COMMUNITIES OF COLOR, WITH SPANISH BEING THE PRIMARY LANGUAGE SPOKEN AT HOME.  TIPPS SEEKS TO INCREASE ACCESS TO ECMH SERVICES, INCLUDING EVIDENCE-BASED PRACTICES (EBPS), SUCH AS: PLAY THERAPY CHILD PARENT PSYCHOTHERAPY (CCP), AND CIRCLE OF SECURITY-PARENTING (COS-P), AND THERAPEUTIC NURSERY PROGRAM (TNP) - AN ECMH PREVENTION-INTERVENTION PROGRAM; TOO STRENGTHEN THE ECMH WORKFORCE BY PROVIDING PBIS TRAINING TO SPECIAL EDUCATION TEAM, AND TO IMPROVE PRESCHOOL STUDENT OUTCOME BY SUPPORTING THE EC WORKFORCE THROUGH TELE-CONSULTATION, AND IMPLEMENTING THE BEST PRACTICE ECHO MODEL.  TIPPS WILL SERVE CHILDREN FROM DIVERSE ETHNIC, CULTURAL, AND LINGUISTIC BACKGROUNDS: 30% LATINO, 20% MULTIRACIAL, 30% AFRICAN AMERICAN, AND 20% CAUCASIAN, AND 80% MEDICAID ELIGIBLE.  OVER 30% ARE DUAL LANGUAGE LEARNERS, WITH IMMIGRATION CHALLENGES AND SPANISH OFTEN  BEING THE FIRST LANGUAGE.  TIPPS ANTICIPATES SERVING 115 INFANTS AND YOUNG CHILDREN, 75 PARENTS AND CAREGIVERS, AND 40 PROFESSIONALS OVER THE ONE YEAR OF THIS PROJECT'S LIFETIME.

RN WELL-BEING PROJECT - THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAS TAKEN AN EXTRAORDINARY MENTAL AND EMOTIONAL TOLL ON OUR NATION'S NURSES, WHO ARE THE LARGEST SECTOR AND MOST TRUSTED OF ALL HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS. HOWEVER, THE UNRELENTING WORK STRESS PLACED ON NURSES HAS BEEN OVERWHELMING EVEN BEFORE THE PANDEMIC. THE OREGON CENTER FOR NURSING'S RN WELL-BEING PROJECT AIMS TO TEST SOLUTIONS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF OREGON TO FIND AND IDENTIFY THE ROOT CAUSES OF STRESS AND BURNOUT FOR NURSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE NURSES' MENTAL AND EMOTIONAL WELL-BEING BASED ON WORK LOCATION (RURAL VS. URBAN), SPECIFIC AFFILIATION (BIPOC, AAPI, LGTBQIA+), AND PRACTICE SETTING (HOSPITAL VS. COMMUNITY-BASED WORKPLACE). A QUALITATIVE SURVEY OF A REPRESENTATIVE SAMPLE OF OREGON NURSES, CONDUCTED IN APRIL 2022, SUGGESTS NURSES CONTINUE TO REPORT SEVERE MENTAL SUFFERING AND EXHAUSTION DESPITE THE HEALTH SUPPORT INITIATIVES IMPLEMENTED BY EMPLOYERS AND STATE AGENCIES. THESE FINDINGS INDICATE A GAP IN PREVENTION MEASURES THAT CONSIDER THE INDIVIDUAL AREA OF PRACTICE, ORGANIZATION, ENVIRONMENT, AND WORKPLACE CULTURE TO SUPPORT MENTAL HEALTH. A LITERATURE REVIEW CONDUCTED BY THE RN WELL-BEING PROJECT REVEALED VARIOUS INTERVENTIONS THAT CAN BE USED TO REDUCE BURNOUT LEVELS AND PREVENT MENTAL HARM. USING AN INNOVATIVE MINI-GRANT MODEL, THE RN WELL-BEING PROJECT WILL PILOT PROJECTS AT ORGANIZATIONS THAT EMPLOY NURSES IN FIVE COUNTIES THROUGHOUT OREGON. THE MINI-GRANT AWARDEES WILL USE EVIDENCE-BASED INTERVENTIONS TO PREVENT, ADDRESS, OR SUPPORT A SPECIFIC NURSE WELL-BEING CHALLENGE WITHIN THE WORKPLACE. IN ADDITION, THE PROJECT WILL AMPLIFY AWARENESS ABOUT NURSE WELL-BEING STRATEGIES AND PROMISING TACTICS, BOTH WITHIN OREGON AND THROUGHOUT THE NATION. RETAINING AN EXPERIENCED NURSING WORKFORCE IS CRUCIAL TO THE HEALTHCARE OF ALL OREGONIANS, AND SUPPORTING NURSES FOLLOWING MASSIVE PUBLIC HEALTH CRISES IS IMPERATIVE. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT ALL OREGONIANS BY RETAINING QUALIFIED AND EXPERIENCED NURSES WHO WILL KEEP OREGON HEALTHY AS WE MOVE INTO THE NEXT NORMAL.

TREAMENT PROGRAM EXPANSION - MILESTONE RECOVERY, A PORTLAND, MAINE BASED NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION, SEEKS SAMHSA FUNDING TO EXPAND THE CAPACITY OF ITS MEDICALLY-MONITORED WITHDRAWAL PROGRAM FOR SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS FROM 16 BEDS TO 24, AND TO ESTABLISH AN OUTPATIENT TREATMENT PROGRAM. THE MEDICALLY-MONITORED WITHDRAWAL PROGRAM IS A 3-7 DAY RESIDENTIAL PROGRAM EMPLOYS BEST-PRACTICE MEDICATION TREATMENT TO HELP CLIENTS NAVIGATE THE ACUTE SYMPTOMS OF WITHDRAWAL FROM ADDICTIVE SUBSTANCES (INCLUDING ALCOHOL, OPIOIDS, COCAINE, AND BENZODIAZEPINES) WHILE ALSO OFFERING COUNSELING TO HELP CLIENTS IDENTIFY AND ACCESS RESOURCES FOR THE NEXT STAGE OF THEIR COMMUNITY-BASED RECOVERY. THE NEW OUTPATIENT PROGRAM WILL HELP STRENGTHEN OUTCOMES FOR CLIENTS BY PROVIDING COMMUNITY-BASED MEDICAL SUPPORT FOR CLIENTS COMPLETING THE WITHDRAWAL PROGRAM, OR FOR THOSE WHO ARE UNABLE TO ATTEND A RESIDENTIAL PROGRAM BECAUSE OF FAMILY OR WORK COMMITMENTS. THE ONLY SUCH FACILITY IN SOUTHERN MAINE THAT PROVIDES SERVICES TO MAINE RESIDENTS STRUGGLING WITH SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS WHO ARE UNINSURED OR RELY ON MEDICAID INSURANCE, MILESTONE’S PROGRAM PRIMARILY SERVES LOW-INCOME AND VERY-LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS. INDEED, FULLY 84% OF CLIENTS IN THE PROGRAM RELY ON MEDICAID FOR HEALTH INSURANCE, AND AN ADDITIONAL 12.5% HAVE NO INSURANCE, MEANING ONLY 3.5% OF CLIENTS HAVE ACCESS TO PRIVATE INSURANCE. OVER 40% OF CLIENTS ARE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS AT THE TIME OF ADMISSION. THE GOAL OF EXPANDING THE CAPACITY OF THE DETOX PROGRAM IS TO SERVE AS MANY CLIENTS AS POSSIBLE. THE EXPANDED PROGRAM WILL RECORD AN ESTIMATED 1,460 ADMISSIONS EACH YEAR, SERVING AN ESTIMATED 1,250 UNIQUE CLIENTS. THE OUTPATIENT PROGRAM, MEANWHILE, IS SUSPECTED TO SERVE APPROXIMATELY 22 CLIENTS PER YEAR. THE EXPANSION OF THE PROGRAM WILL NECESSITATE THE LEASE AND RENOVATION OF A NEW FACILITY FUNDED WITH NON-SAMHSA FUNDS, AS WELL AS HIRING OF NEW NURSING AND COUNSELING STAFF TO BE FUNDED WITH SAMHSA FUNDS FOR THE FIRST YEAR. AFTER THE FIRST YEAR OF OPERATIONS, THE PROGRAM IS PROJECTED TO REACH SUSTAINABILITY BASED ON MEDICAID SERVICE REIMBURSEMENTS AND AN EXISTING CONTRACT WITH MAINE’S OFFICE OF BEHAVIORAL HEALTH.

MOBILE CRISIS RESPONSE TEAM EXPANSION - JUST AS COMMUNITIES NATIONWIDE HAVE DEMANDED ALTERNATIVES TO POLICE RESPONSE TO BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CRISES, CALIFORNIA'S CONTRA COSTA COUNTY RESIDENTS HAVE LIKEWISE DEMANDED INCREASED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CRISIS SERVICES.  CONTRA COSTA BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES (CCBHS) PROPOSES TO EXPAND EXISTING MOBILE CRISIS RESPONSE TEAMS (MCRTS) TO MORE FULLY ADDRESS THE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH NEEDS OF COUNTY RESIDENTS BY ADDING TWO TEAMS TO MORE RAPIDLY RESPOND TO RESIDENTS IN CRISIS THAN IS CURRENTLY POSSIBLE WITH EXISTING STAFF GIVEN THE INCREASING NEED FOR EMERGENCY RESPONSE OVER THE PAST YEARS AND THE LARGE GEOGRAPHIC AREA OF CONTRA COSTA, WITH LONG TRAVEL TIMES FROM WEST TO THE EAST COUNTY ESPECIALLY DURING COMMUTE HOURS.  WITH THE INCREASED NUMBERS OF RESIDENTS EXPERIENCING SUBSTANCE USE ISSUES, CCBHS ALSO PROPOSES ADDING SUBSTANCE USE COUNSELORS TO TEAMS TO MORE EFFECTIVELY ADDRESS CRISES RELATED TO SUBSTANCE USE AND CO-OCCURRING CONDITIONS.  THE ADDITIONAL MCRT STAFFING WOULD COME TO A COST OF $1,061,522.

MENTAL HEALTH & SUBSTANCE USE SERVICES FOR LONG-TERM SURVIVORS OF HIV/AIDS PROJECT - SAN FRANCISCO AIDS FOUNDATION (SFAF) WILL INTEGRATE MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE USE SERVICES INTO ESTABLISHED COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROGRAMMING FOR LONG TERM SURVIVORS OF HIV/AIDS. THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON BLACK/AFRICAN AMERICAN COMMUNTIES, TRANSGENDER COMMUNITIES, AND PEOPLE WHO USE DRUGS (PWUD). STONEWALL PROJECT, SFAF’S EXISTING STATE-CERTIFIED ALCOHOL AND DRUG TREATMENT PROGRAM, WILL PARTNER WITH EXISTING COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM STAFF TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT CULTURALLY RESPONSIVE MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE USE SERVICES. THIS PARTNERSHIP WILL EXPAND AVAILABLE SERVICES FOR LONG TERM SURVIVORS OF HIV/AIDS AND AS A RESULT, SFAF WILL PROVIDE A CONTINUUM OF CARE THAT INCLUDES MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES, SUBSTANCE USE TREATMENT, AND CASE MANAGEMENT SERVICES. THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO REDUCE ISOLATION, AND SUPPORT INDIVIDUALS WITH MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE USE NEEDS, MEANINGFULLY ENGAGE LONG TERM SURVIVORS IN COMMUNITY BUILDING EFFORTS, AND STABILIZE SAFETY NETWORKS FOR THESE PRIORITY COMMUNITIES.  SFAF WILL REDUCE SOCIAL ISOLATION AMONG LONG TERM SURVIVORS OF HIV/AIDS AND THEIR NETWORKS BY INCREASING UTILIZATION OF PSYCHOSOCIAL GROUPS AND EVENTS.  SFAF WILL DECREASE HARMS ASSOCIATED WITH SUBSTANCE MISUSE AMONG LONG TERM SURVIVORS OF HIV/AIDS AND THEIR NETWORKS BY INCREASING ACCESS TO A CONTINUUM OF SUBSTANCE USE SERVICES.  150 LONG TERM SURVIVORS WILL BE ENGAGED IN THE 12-MONTH PROJECT THROUGH GROUP AND INDIVIDUAL LEVEL INTERVENTIONS, INCLUDING PSYCHOSOCIAL SUPPORT GROUPS, SUBSTANCE USE EDUCATIONAL GROUPS, SOCIAL SUPPORT AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT EVENTS, SUBSTANCE USE COUNSELING, AND HIV AND AGING CASE MANAGEMENT.  SFAF HAS IDENTIFIED LONG TERM SURVIVORS OF HIV/AIDS–WITH SPECIFIC FOCUS ON BLACK/AFRICAN AMERICAN COMMUNITIES, TRANSGENDER COMMUNITIES, AND PEOPLE WHO USE DRUGS–AS UNDER-RESOURCED POPULATIONS WITH AN UNMET NEED FOR MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE USE TREATMENT SERVICES.
AZUSA TEEN AND FAMILY CENTER - THE AZUSA TEEN CENTER BRINGS TOGETHER BRINGS TOGETHER ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE TRANSFORMATIVE SERVICES FOR YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES IN AZUSA

CONGRESSIONAL DIRECTIVE SPENDING PROJECT GRANT - PROVIDE MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES - FOR ASHLEY ADDICTION TREATMENT CENTER. - IN CECIL COUNTY, MARYLAND, THERE IS A LACK OF ACCESSIBLE MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES, PARTICULARLY FOR THOSE THAT UTILIZE MEDICAID.  PATIENTS WITH COMORBID SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER AND MENTAL HEALTH DISORDERS ARE AT PARTICULAR RISK, AS SERVICES TO TREAT THOSE PATIENTS ARE EVEN LESS AVAILABLE AND THEIR TREATMENT IS MORE COMPLEX.  ASHLEY ADDICTION TREATMENT HAS PROVIDED OUTPATIENT TREATMENT FOR SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS IN ELKTON, MARYLAND (CECIL COUNTY) FOR OVER FIVE YEARS, BUT HAS BEEN UNABLE TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES DUE TO FINANCIAL CONSTRAINTS.  THE PLANNED PROGRAM WILL NOT ONLY PROVIDE TREATMENT FOR THOSE DUAL DIAGNOSIS PATIENTS THAT PARTICIPATE IN ASHLEY’S OUTPATIENT PROGRAM, BUT WILL ALSO SERVE THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE TO INCREASE ACCESSIBILITY TO MUCH NEEDED MENTAL HEALTH CARE.

NEVADA SYSTEM OF HIGHER EDUCATION MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES PILOT PROJECT - THE NEVADA SYSTEM OF HIGHER EDUCATION (NSHE) MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES PILOT PROJECT SEEKS FUNDING TO:  1.	HIRE A MENTAL HEALTH WELLNESS OFFICER IN ITS SYSTEM ADMINISTRATION OFFICE TO SUPPORT THE WORK OF THE NSHE MENTAL HEALTH TASK FORCE (MHTF), LEAD THE EFFORT TO CONDUCT A SYSTEM-WIDE NEEDS ASSESSMENT OF THE MENTAL HEALTH AND EMOTIONAL WELLBEING OF ITS STUDENTS, FACULTY, AND STAFF, AND TO IDENTIFY, COORDINATE, AND PROVIDE SUICIDE AWARENESS AND PREVENTION TRAINING TO FACULTY, STAFF, AND STUDENTS ACROSS THE SYSTEM; AND   2.	ASSIST NSHE’S INSTITUTIONS WITH IDENTIFYING, COORDINATING, AND PROVIDING MENTAL HEALTH FIRST AID, OR COMPARABLE OR EQUIVALENT TRAINING, AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES TO FACULTY, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT EACH OF THE INSTITUTIONAL CAMPUSES.  THE NSHE MHTF, FORMED IN JANUARY 2021, WAS ESTABLISHED IN RESPONSE TO AN INCREASE IN MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES EXPERIENCED BY NSHE STUDENTS, FACULTY AND STAFF DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. SURVEY ASSESSMENT IS A RECOMMENDED BEST PRACTICE FROM THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF STUDENT AFFAIRS ADMINISTRATORS AND CENTER FOR COLLEGIATE MENTAL HEALTH.  THE MHTF HAS DETERMINED THAT ESTABLISHING A BASELINE OF SYSTEM-WIDE DATA IS AN ESSENTIAL FIRST STEP TOWARD DETERMINING AND UNDERSTANDING THE NEEDS OF THE NSHE COMMUNITY.   THE NSHE IS A MAJORITY-MINORITY SYSTEM SERVING OVER 140,000 STUDENTS, STAFF AND FACULTY, IN BOTH URBAN AND RURAL COMMUNITIES. THIS UNIQUE CHARACTERISTIC SERVES AS A GOOD MICROCOSM OF DEMOGRAPHY FOR WHAT THE NATION WILL SOON LOOK LIKE POPULATION WISE. IDENTIFYING THE NEEDS OF THOSE WHO ARE FROM HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES AND WHO MAY HAVE BEEN DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY THE PANDEMIC AND RESULTING ECONOMIC DOWNTURN, WILL ALLOW NSHE AND OTHERS TO BEST ADDRESS ACUTE ISSUES UNIQUELY IMPACTING THIS POPULATION.  SUICIDE AWARENESS AND PREVENTION TRAINING TEACHES ADULTS HOW TO IDENTIFY PEOPLE WHO MAY BE AT RISK FOR SUICIDE AND HOW TO LINK THEM TO CARE, WHILE MENTAL HEALTH FIRST AID TRAINING IS PROVEN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN TEACHING ADULTS HOW TO RECOGNIZE AND RESPOND TO SIGNS AND SYMPTOMS OF MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE USE CHALLENGES. MENTAL HEALTH FIRST AID TRAINING IS A RECOMMENDED BEST PRACTICE BY THE NATIONAL COUNCIL FOR MENTAL HEALTH WELLBEING.  TOGETHER, THESE TRAININGS WILL PROVIDE GUIDANCE ON HOW TO SAFELY INTERVENE AND SUPPORT THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO NEED ASSISTANCE.   DUE TO FUNDING AND STAFFING CHALLENGES, THE NSHE FINDS ITSELF WITH A NEED FOR A PROJECT MANAGER TO LEAD THE TWO-PRONGED SYSTEM AND INSTITUTIONAL LEVEL MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES PILOT PROJECT. THE NSHE, LED BY THE MENTAL HEALTH WELLNESS OFFICER, PLANS TO DISTRIBUTE THE MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS SURVEY TO AT LEAST 85% OF FACULTY AND STAFF, AND 85% OF STUDENTS ACROSS THE SYSTEM INSTITUTIONS WITH A 60% PARTICIPATION RATE EXPECTED. FURTHERMORE, THE NSHE PLANS TO PROVIDE EVIDENCE-BASED SUICIDE AWARENESS AND PREVENTION TRAINING AT THE SYSTEM LEVEL TO AT LEAST 3,000 OF ITS FACULTY, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AT THE SYSTEM LEVEL.   THE NSHE’S INSTITUTIONS COMBINED PLAN IS TO PROVIDE AT LEAST 7 EVIDENCE-BASED MENTAL HEALTH FIRST AID TRAININGS (1 TRAINING AT EACH OF THE TRADITIONAL INSTITUTIONS) TO AT LEAST 3,000 FACULTY, STAFF, AND STUDENTS AS WELL. FUNDING WILL ALSO BE USED BY THE INSTITUTIONS TO SUPPORT ADDITIONAL AND TARGETED PERSONNEL, TARGETED PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES, INCLUDING CONFERENCE PARTICIPATION AND PROFESSIONAL MEMBERSHIPS, AND THE PURCHASING OF EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES AS PART OF THE TRAINING COMPONENT.

EXPANSION OF SPECIALTY MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES TO YOUTH IN ORANGE COUNTY, CA - MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS FOR CHILDREN, ALREADY IN HIGH DEMAND, HAVE SKY-ROCKETED DURING THE PANDEMIC.  ORANGE COUNTY CALIFORNIA HAS SEEN LARGE INCREASES IN DEMAND, SUCH AS A 41% INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN PRESENTING TO THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT IN PSYCHIATRIC CRISIS DESPITE THE OPENING OF ADDITIONAL CRISIS STABILIZATION RESOURCES IN THE COUNTY. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ALLOW CHILDREN’S HOSPITAL OF ORANGE COUNTY (CHOC) TO EXPAND CAPACITY FOR SEVERAL IMPORTANT MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAMS FOR THE CHILDREN IN OUR COUNTY.  PROPOSED PROGRAMMATIC EXPANSION IS IN 3 MAIN AREAS:  HOPE CLINIC:  A NEW CLINIC THAT CAN PROVIDE RAPID APPOINTMENTS (WITHIN 1 TO 3 DAYS) FOR CHILDREN IN CRISIS WHO WOULD OTHERWISE NEED TO GO TO THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT, WITH A GOAL TO REDUCE THE RISE IN NEW PATIENTS PRESENTING TO CHOC’S ED.  IT IS BASED ON A SUCCESSFUL PROGRAM IN OHIO.  CHILDREN AND FAMILIES RECEIVE UP TO 4 SESSIONS TO ALLOW FOR CRISIS STABILIZATION AND CONNECTION WITH OUTPATIENT SERVICES IN THE COMMUNITY.  FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE ADDITION OF A CHILD AND ADOLESCENT PSYCHIATRIST WHEN NEEDED TO ASSESS FOR MEDICATION AND TO MONITOR MEDICATION UNTIL THE CHILD IS CONNECTED WITH COMMUNITY SERVICES; PURCHASE OF OFFICE FURNITURE FOR STAFF AND FURNITURE FOR PATIENTS AND FAMILIES (SUCH AS CHAIRS AND DESK); COMPUTERS FOR OFFICE STAFF; TABLETS FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF SCREENING ASSESSMENTS SUCH AS THE PHQ-9-A; AND FOR ADDITIONAL STAFF TRAINING IN EVIDENCE BASED TREATMENT FOR MANAGEMENT OF AND INTERVENTION WITH CHILDREN AT RISK OF SUICIDE AND MATERIALS FOR FAMILIES (SUCH AS BOOKS, WORKSHEETS, ETC).  YOUNG CHILD CLINIC:  CHOC RECENTLY BEGAN A YOUNG CHILD CLINIC TO PROVIDE SPECIALTY SERVICES FOR CHILDREN 8 YEARS AND UNDER.  ORANGE COUNTY HAS FEW PROVIDERS WITH SPECIALTY SERVICES FOR YOUNGER CHILDREN WHO HAVE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SYMPTOMS/CONDITIONS AND DO NOT HAVE AUTISM.  THIS CLINIC PROVIDES EVIDENCE- BASED INTERVENTIONS DEVELOPED FOR YOUNGER CHILDREN SUCH AS THE INCREDIBLE YEARS AND PARENT CHILD INTERACTION TRAINING (PCIT).  TO EXPAND THE SERVICES, WE ARE REQUESTING FUNDING TO ALLOW FOR FURNITURE SPECIFIC FOR CHILDREN, TO PROVIDE TOYS AND GAMES NECESSARY FOR PROVIDING PCIT IN PERSON, INSTALLATION OF A TWO-WAY MIRROR TO ALLOW FOR CLINICIANS TO DIRECTLY OBSERVE PARENT INTERACTIONS WITH THEIR CHILD AND PROVIDE REAL TIME FEEDBACK AND INSTRUCTIONS; TO PURCHASE EQUIPMENT NECESSARY FOR RECORDING OF SESSIONS AND TO STORE THIS INFORMATION AND TO ALLOW FOR PCIT CERTIFICATION FOR AN ADDITIONAL STAFF MEMBER, WITH A GOAL TOWARDS INCREASING THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN SEEN.  INTENSIVE OUTPATIENT PROGRAM:  CHOC PROVIDES A DIALECTICAL AND BEHAVIORAL THERAPY (DBT) ADHERENT OUTPATIENT INTENSIVE PROGRAM (IOP) FOR HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WITH PERSISTENT SUICIDAL IDEATION AND/OR SELF-INJURIOUS BEHAVIOR.  THE PROGRAM IS 8 WEEKS IN LENGTH, 3 HOURS OF TREATMENT EACH DAY, 4 DAYS A WEEK WITH A MIX OF GROUP, FAMILY AND INDIVIDUAL THERAPY SERVICES.  WHILE THE PROGRAM IS INTENSIVE, WE HAVE A HIGH COMPLETION RATE, WITH A FISCAL YEAR TO DATE NO SHOW RATE OF UNDER 1 PERCENT, 3 PATIENTS NOT MEETING GRADUATION REQUIREMENTS AND ONLY 2 PATIENTS HOSPITALIZED WITHIN 6 MONTHS OF PROGRAM COMPLETION.  UNFORTUNATELY, AT THIS TIME CALIFORNIA MEDICAID DOES NOT REIMBURSE FOR THIS LEVEL OF CARE FOR MENTAL HEALTH DIAGNOSES (BUT DOES FOR SUBSTANCE USE SERVICES).  WE ARE REQUESTING FUNDING TO COVER ATTENDANCE IN THIS PROGRAM FOR 6 PATIENTS WITH MEDICAID COVERAGE WITH HIGH RISK OF INPATIENT PSYCHIATRIC HOSPITALIZATION.

MULTNOMAH COUNTY BEHAVIORAL HEALTH RESOURCE CENTER OUTREACH AND COMMUNICATIONS ACCESS PROJECT - THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE CREATION OF A PEER-LED, CULTURALLY-RESPONSIVE AND TRAUMA-INFORMED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH RESOURCE CENTER (BHRC) IN DOWNTOWN PORTLAND, OREGON, CURRENTLY HOME TO A MAJORITY OF THE REGION'S GROWING NUMBER OF CHRONICALLY HOUSELESS RESIDENTS - MANY OF WHOM EXPERIENCE BEHAVIORAL CHALLENGES AND BARRIERS TO ACCESSING SERVICES. THIS PROJECT IS A SHARED VISION, REALIZED THROUGH COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS BY LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, BUSINESSES, SERVICE PROVIDERS AND PEOPLE WHO HOPE TO FIND SAFETY AND SUPPORT WITHIN THE BHRC COMMUNITY. PLANNING EFFORTS HAVE UNDERSCORED THE NEED FOR OUTREACH AND COMMUNICATION WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS PRIOR TO OPENING, SLATED FOR NOVEMBER 2022. REQUESTED FUNDS WILL SUPPORT HIRING AND TRAINING SIX PEER STAFF TO CONDUCT OUTREACH AND A MEDIA CAMPAIGN AIMED AT ENSURING BHRC ACCEPTANCE BY CONSUMERS, BUSINESSES, RESIDENTS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS.

TRI-COUNTY MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES VETERAN MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES - AT TRI-COUNTY MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES (TCMHS), WE BELIEVE THAT WE HAVE A MORAL AND ETHICAL OBLIGATION TO DO WHAT WE CAN TO HELP OUR SERVICE MEMBERS, VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS SEEK THE HELP AND RECEIVE THE SERVICES AND BENEFITS THEY ARE RIGHTFULLY DUE.  OUR VETERAN'S OUTREACH COORDINATOR, LT. COL. JERRY DEWITT, HELPS SERVICE MEMBER AND VETERANS ACCESS THE ONGOING CARE AND RECEIVE THE CONSIDERATION THEY DESERVE.  LT. COL. DEWITT HELPS OUR COMMUNITY'S SERVICE MEMBERS, VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS UNDERSTAND THE BENEFITS AVAILABLE TO THEM AND HOW TO APPLY.
